yMhV2RUJLykllwb1WRiR_g.text: Came here during a weekend trip to Charlotte. They are pet friendly and family and I were happy we were able to sit on the patio with our puppies. The server (forgot his name) was so friendly and welcoming with a sense of humor and he made our visit absolutely enjoyable. Ordered the ribs which were delicious and the potato salad was great! Ramen mac and cheese was a unique concept but I wouldn't go back for it.   My only issue is the size of the tofu. While the sauce is delicious, the tofu blocks are cut too large so it makes it hard to taste the sauce on every bite of tofu. My only advice would be to cut the tofu into smaller bite size blocks so the sauce doesn't disappear and it's easier to eat :)

OCkECiyWVD9w7QdnhmYXkg.text: Fantastic atmosphere, attentive service, and delicious food - no complaints here! The fella and I stopped in around 5 pm on a Saturday (I know, early bird special), and we were promptly seated. I loved the concrete floors and aluminum chairs (which were pretty comfy for aluminum) and the twinkly lights strung above. Even though it had an industrial feel, it was still cozy. And I did love the constant Asian rap videos/music playing... super fun vibe.  I wish I could tell you our waitress' name because she was so helpful and fun! She gave us the quick rundown on the menu, and we decided to try a little bit of everything. Here's how the food shook out:  - Small order of wings (6 total) half & half on the sauce: the wings are bigger than I expected, so I'm glad we went small. The fella loves a little heat, but the spicy wings were too messy for him. He needed a wet wipe and two napkins after just one wing. The soy garlic were amazing - great balance of sweet and salt. - Crispy pork belly: the fella's favorite, just okay for me. The fried part was so hard, I thought I was gonna crack a tooth. - Pulled pork : my favorite, by far. I almost got the meat sweats just from this. - Dirty white rice: pretty good, but just a dollop of a sesame/soy pasty dressing on top of white rice. - Potato swirl: not really spicy like they say, but they do sprinkle sriracha dust on the spiral. The sauce it comes with didn't add anything to it. Pretty darn tasty.  All that plus two glasses of wine and a Red Clay cider cost just under $70. A steal!  They have a ton of drink options, too - local craft beer, Asian craft beer, cider, wine, cocktails, sake, and other fun options. We sat at the bar for an after-dinner drink and saw waitresses carving up huge watermelons and pouring liquor into them.  It was too hot the day we went, but there was also a pretty cool looking patio with umbrellas along Church St.  I know the reviews on this place have been mixed, and it's possible we were just there on their best day yet, but we couldn't find anything not to like about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main dining area
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

BdoslAex9L1n75JKcHeI6A.text: Seoul Food killed it!  A total experience from start to finish, other restaurants could learn from this place.  From the K pop music videos playing all over to the passionate and knowledgeable waitress, you knew you were somewhere completely different.  The food was different too, and delicious.  I gotta give a shout out to the chicken wings, they were like little Korean fried chicken!! Everything else was delicious too, even the drinks.  I kept watching food coming out of the kitchen and it all looked bomb, good job guys

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

E0YJh6qjj09ZgrWue1rLkQ.text: I'm an out of towner who has family in the area, and every time I come to CLT we can't help but to stop at this place for a quick bite. This place conceptually is clever, they have karaoke rooms that you can rent, outdoor seating and a bar, games and a dog park, and has Korean music videos playing on flat screens throughout. Very new hipster CLT vibes, but a great place to bring the family for a fun night out, or erm day drinking for the younger crowd. I deff wouldn't call this place kid friendly, but I've been here with family ages 20-70 and we all had a great time.   Now on to the menu. The food comes out on giant trays for the table, and everything is served family style so you can try different stuff if you wish. Things I loved were: the bulgogi tacos, Ram Mac--fusion of ramen mac and cheese, the birds nest--sweet potato straws piled high, the pork belly, and the soy garlic wings--if you love wings these are for you (!) super crispy and crunchy with a savory and sweet sauce. The drinks are also clever and delicious, pineapple soju that comes in an actual pineapple, and the prickly pear cocktail are some faves.  All in all this spot has great customer service, creative food, and great vibes. Will continue to come back!

vQX6IHdmi5dNFKp2fscuZA.text: This was our first time eating dinner at this restaurant. We located it on yelp after a disappointing attempt to eat dinner at another Asian restaurant. However, it was the best thing that could have happened.  The service here was fantastic. Our waitress was training another person and still managed to provide excellent service with a smile. She explained the menu and dishes to us in detail. She answered all of our questions making it a pleasant atmosphere.  The manager even stopped by our table to give us a discount on a karaoke room for our next visit.  The food did not disappoint. The beef ribs were so tender and delicious. They were great on the bao buns with the homemade sauce. I loved the kimchi fries, and my wife really enjoyed the pimento corn cheese paired with the shrimp toast. We both loved our bulgogi spring rolls too. The portions were great and the prices too. We arrived during happy hour to find the sides for only a $1.  They have a inside and outside bar area with great music and karaoke rooms. They even have a pet friendly play area for your dog. We will definitely return and tell our friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef ribs, ramen mac&amp;cheese, pimento corn cheese, boa buns, kimchi fries.
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

EL_Hvc1QC4LUVMYhho97fw.text: This place is amazing. The soy garlic chicken wings are a real winner and the patio is wonderful, so many great games. Try the pineapple beer, surprisingly delicious!!

MsE3T_hwVwk5UsqXMFg2lw.text: Always a great experience -- and my mom's favorite!   Never had anything that doesn't blow me away. Potato swirl is to die for, fire chicken is amazing.  Was told by server that food would take longer than usual due to kitchen power outage I believe, no problem! Food came in completely reasonable time, hot and fresh as ever.  Would return every day if I could.

BiEK0UIRDqjBW1YUAGyGrQ.text: So many great things to say about this place! Delicious beer (try the blueberry), GIANT wings, amazing kimchi fries, great fish tacos!! The service was fast and our waiter was extremely knowledgeable of the entire menu and receptive of any questions we had! I'm leaving completely stuffed and totally satisfied!

E7gClUr05csMQGnjbzzmPA.text: Such a fun place! The food is unique and well prepared. Not a lot of fuss. But the outdoor bar is great, complete with games like beer pong. Refreshingly different.

9Kgc303VMRwjGB3FjHA8ZA.text: I really love Korean food so I may be too picky but after going here twice, I did not like this place.  The menu items are titled well but don't live up to the name. Ramen Mac and cheese seems like it should be something amazing but it's ramen with cafeteria cheese on top.  The Kim chi sausage is bland and the guys at our table had fun coming up with analogies as to how dry it was (it's so post-apocalyptic wasteland it could win 6 oscars).  The sweet potato nest is sticky gooey and falls apart easily, making it hard to eat.  The chicken wings are breaded heavily and very sticky also.    The pulled pork and beef ribs are decent as is the Kim chi slaw and potato swirl.  The pimento cheese isn't bad either.  But honestly this restaurant is in south end; if you want great chicken wings, tavern on the tracks is up the road.  If you want pulled pork, you can check out saucemans or macs.  And if you're hankering for some good Asian fare, you're better off going to futo buta, nikkos, or ru sans.  The dishes that should differentiate this place from other restaurants are boring and bad and the dishes they do acceptably can be done better by nearby restaurants so unless one of those are too busy, I'd suggest going there.

p2MZD97DnSHvtUT4NW2a0A.text: i love love love this restaurant the fried tilapia is amazing as well as the sides literally got full for a reasonable amount, second time being there and it was as amazing as the first

sEizDsN42t6rAG33KwUScA.text: There's nothing that negatively comes to mind about Seoul food meat company. From the moment we sat down Christie was very helpful and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. Even the trainee was very attentive to my water staying refilled. The food was fast and absolutely delicious. My brother and I decided to split an order of 20 half and half wings as well as some pulled pork and brisket tacos.  Between the two of us we still left with half of each taco as well as 10 wings because they are so big!  I have been raving about it since stepping out of the building. It was a very satisfying experience. Definitely on the list of places to suggest as I look forward to trying more things on the menu.

ShYXioVYJ58lKcNSK9PMTw.text: Mediocre food, at best. Absolutely terrible service. We ate and drank at the outside bar where two dudes struggled to handle the work load. And it certainly wasn't busy by traditional standards. We ordered the ramen mac and cheese as one of our sides and they brought out something that looked liked ramen with Wendy's chili poured over it. We immediately said we didn't order that and we won't eat it. The kid bartender said that's what we ordered and he can't switch it out, nor take it off the bill. I said we ordered the mac and cheese ramen, so bring it out. I wasn't going to argue. He would simply have to pay for it out of his tip. Perhaps he should write orders down if he can't remember them. Then as we were eating, we watched him do the same thing to a girl who ordered a drink. She told him she didn't order that drink, and again he said he can't take it off the bill. The drink sat on top of the cooler for 10 minutes and then he sold it to someone else. Smh.  As for the food, the brisket was on the dry side, lacked natural flavor, and had far too much fat. Both ramen dishes were underwhelming and basic. The pulled pork wasn't awful, but definitely forgettable. The pimento corn cheese was a tiny, tiny portion with way too many "chips" that were made of shrimp but were more like pork rinds. The fully loaded potato salad's flavor was bland, yet dominated by the taste of cucumber.  This place was such a disappointment.

1i1uI7zWlUC6CDoqEsiT3A.text: Oh my gosh! So my friend and I are always trying to find new restaurants to try and I am so glad we (she) finally found this one. Let's start with the location - perfectly tucked away but still right in South End! plenty of parking to the side of the building.   Our server (it kills me that I can't remember her name) was so sweet and asked if we had dined there before. when we said we hadn't, she took her time explaining the menu to us.   Everything sounded so good, but we decided on the fire chicken, mac & cheese ramen, potato swirl, and sriracha cracklins. My favorite, hands down, was the ramen. IT WAS SO GOOD I was scraping the cheese off of the side of the cardboard container.   The fire chicken was so tender and juicy. We ordered a small and I still had enough to take home. The potato swirl was good and reminds me of festival food but with flair. Our least favorite were the cracklins, which were still good, but just kinda reminded us of spicy pork rinds.   We will definitely be back - soon! I wish I could give more kudos to our server as she really was the sweetest. They're inexpensive and they play super cool K-Pop videos that my friend and I couldn't stop watching.   Yum! :)

TBUptdPqZ8COjr4zyJJU7Q.text: Love the food and the people and the ambiance ...go for the food stay for the drunken karaoke. If you love traditional foods with a twist and creative appetizers to your hearts content this is the place for you. Take your family, buddies and anyone willing to try new foods out and become an American idol.

vTP2aP6KAowhpGyinXOC6g.text: A total gem! The crispy pork belly is out of this world. Be prepared to wait for your table. I'm impatient and get hangry but I still think it's worth the wait.

UZJpucVDNhwQOAWbnD2M9A.text: The food was AWESOME! There wasn't anything our group ordered that was questionable. There is outside seating though we chose to sit inside due to the heat. The noise level needs to be buffered slightly for conversation purposes! Great energy! Warning: The bbq will have your eyes rolling back into your head! The BIGGY is there are items on the menu everyone can choose from... GF/DF/Vegetarian along with the eat everything-ers!

nZO1Cq7UI3mKqLAGiiDNxQ.text: Not bad but nothing to rave about. It gets a little bro-y so if that's the vibe you're into then this is the place for you.

SNVmZuIPdFFif8OsZ_e-2w.text: This place is worth a try.  I wouldn't eat here everyday as the food is very heavy, but the meat is always cooked to perfection and the food presentation makes eating fun.  However, I was not a fan of the Ramen Mac and Cheese, it has a weird taste to it.  They also have a variety of cocktails poured into carved fruit, they are fun but overpriced for the amount of alcohol you actually get.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZtshHxqDaIEKrsgjN796FA.text: A Unique Menu and a Great Atmosphere!  I am giving this place 3 starts because I did not like their take on traditional chicken wings.  They attempted to do an Asian style breading, on a bone-in chicken wing.  The breading was heavy and thick, and I was never confident whether I was biting into breading, chicken, or bone, until I had committed to the bite.  It's a strange way to eat chicken wings.  Aside from that, the atmosphere is great.  They have a nice patio with a view of uptown.  I really want to go back and try something else.  It is so promising, with this unique menu, that I must give it another shot. I will try the BBQ next time, and we will see.

A2FexU-X_93feNMzIht-VQ.text: This place is awesome! We had the wings and they are the best I've had!  You have to try them. We had the mac and cheese, the beef sushi, the beef and kimchi empanada. I'm a big fan of their kimchi.  The service was perfect. Jnelle was very friendly, she had great recommendations and she made sure we had everything we needed, without being overbearing.

-oXRH-a1_yQPKA4m8RMfzw.text: Really fun place to hang out for all different kinds of fun! Their small plate dishes are great for trying everything and sharing with a group of friends. I came here for a small engagement celebration and had a great server for the 13 of us, which I know is a lot! The food came out fast, hot and delicious. Then we made sure to hit up one of the many karaoke booths! How cool is that? Also have a nice bar patio. On a sat my friends and I came to share watermelons, coconuts, etc filled with alcohol. I recommend stopping by here if you ever haven't!

4jNzq314hND8GLAe9Jv-6w.text: Crazy good place with an incredible variety!  Come hungry and leave stuffed with goodness you won't find anywhere else.

7iauhdQmJWSqAf3OsqOKWA.text: I absolutely fell in love with this place.  I took a girl here on our first date and needless to say, thank God I did.  The ambiance was great.  I loved their take on Korean bbq.  We were so stuffed and on cloud nine that I felt that I could have taken over the world one Korean rib at a time.  Charlotte foodies.  Give this place a shot.  It's on my list of places to revisit when I make it back to the east coast.

n42zEaxjl7wORdIp-HhW_Q.text: Making it simple Pros: Location cool Server was great Drinks ok - yuzu and lychee drinks Sides were ok to good .. Mac/eggs Pork belly was well fried pork belly ...ruin that and u really suck. Portion was good.  Cons  Wings battered and the batter steams the chicken. Nah man. Also the flavor bland and too much batter. Sauces are made for the lowest common denominator.  Expensive. Price did not match quality.  If you ever had decent bbq or decent Korean a mash up sounds like a easy win. Well.... That didn't happen.  Basic bros and broads and the hot new I'm cool because I'm here folks will like it. If you like food you can pass. I could possibly come back to try a couple of sides I didn't get but overall... I'm good on this place. Plus I don't feel so well.   -

PDpn_DVPoxpxtpL9yKkXKg.text: This was my first time having Korean food, and I would have to say I loved it!  I know this is different than the traditional, but it was awesome!  My friend suggested it, and I'm so happy I gave it a try!  It's a cool twist and something different compared to all the normal bar food available.  Cool spot that's good for groups or date night.  All the food I saw looked amazing!!!  I had pulled pork, kimchi + broccoli.  Both the veggies were hot hot hot... very very spicy.  Don't order it if you don't want hot!  The pork was super flavorful.  I also tried my friend's wings, which were soy garlic and so crunchy and flavorful.  Come here for all of the flavors!!!  There's the dining room, a bar, outside seating and from what I hear a karaoke room!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Choiang Broccoli + Pulled Pork + Kimchi Vinegar Slaw

qxRxoEySn7lJu6aoLXywYQ.text: Not your traditional Korean BBQ joint, but the food was yummy! Great portions and very tasty. Marquis was a great server and very knowledgeable about the menu items. We were a party of 3 and had leftovers. We recommend the beef ribs and crispy pork belly. The wings are breaded so if you like them naked, they do not offer it. The bulgogi kim bap was really tasty! I'll definitely come again when I visit Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green Tea Ice Cream with Sugar Biscuits
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato Swirl
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soy Pickled Deviled Eggs

mmatSUYnOOiTKHPeB5S-CQ.text: The atmosphere at Seoul Food is one of the best in town. If it's a warm afternoon, the back patio of Seoul is the place to be. They offer an interesting variety of drinks and beers, with a couple of fun novelty drinks that are served in the actual fruit it's made from!   If there's one thing you positively can't miss at Seoul it is their wings. If you love oversized extra crispy wings with the most delicious sauce you've ever had this is your place. Go grab a seat at the bar outside, order a drink and embarrass yourself eating wings in front of all the millennials in South End like I do on a regular basis.

KNzncUiBgI0oAilyd45dKQ.text: whenever I come to Charlotte and I know I'm meeting up with a big group, Seoul Food Meat Co. is my go to. The portions are generous and if you come during happy hour (4-6 M-Tr I believe) you can get the food and an AMAZING price.  Since they have this happier hour I try to make a point of only coming here during those times because how can you beat $1 sides!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. left  right: Shrimp chips and pimento cheese corn dip, green tea corn bread, potatoes swirl, kimchi fries, 3 orders of half and half wings

LlgNmXHJbZlEZ27v595y3g.text: This is the place that I take people who have never been to Charlotte when they do come to Charlotte. Their chicken wings are easily some of the best in town, I'm pretty sure that they have won some competitions over the past few years. I would really recommend getting anything that has the words bulgogi in it. The flavors are always really great, they did just raise the price of some of their sides but it's only by a dollar and if you pick the right ones that sound like they're good, then they usually are pretty good. I strongly suggest the pork, fish, or bulgogi taco. I'm not the biggest fan of their drinks, but let's be real, you go there for the food.

2J3-yJuNnG7WnuyujXhbPQ.text: My husband and I stayed near Seoul Food Meat Company during our stay in Charlotte. We were looking for a place that was not exactly fast food since it was late at night and we wanted somewhat decent food. Seoul Food Meat Company was the ultimate life saver! The plus side is that they open late and they have some pretty awesome food to offer. They are a Korean-inspired restaurant with their own fusion.   Here's what we ordered: Crispy pork belly- You want crispy? You got it! This was everything! Sweet potato nest- This dish was completely unique for us. Tasted nothing like this before and so glad that we ordered it! Nice presentation too. Bulgogi fusion taco- This was just okay, which was what we expected, but needed something extra.   Overall, if we were to visit Charlotte again in the nearby area, we would definitely come back to Seoul Food Meat Company. Also good to mention that the staff was extremely friendly!   Note: If you want to order ahead for pick up, you need to leave your credit card information with them.

tJrMzXLrjD9izvmepHM_2A.text: Awesome spot! I have had almost the entire menu and have not been disappointed. The Soju drinks are awesome! My favorite is the watermelon soju in the summer! They hollow out the watermelons and pour the cocktail in it. They also have pineapple ones!   The ramen mac and cheese is a must!  Patios are fun and you can rent karaoke rooms by the hour too.  Service is also good. That's what attracted me back!

DJtRMzFgRHiHPzliWPK9fQ.text: If Seoul knows how to do anything they know how to fry some chicken! 2 flavors of greatness

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried fish taco

S-ccR2DtGY4RmduVPN-qSA.text: One of the most unique restaurants I've been to. They heavily state that they're not a typical Korean bbq place- they're a southern bbq place with an Asian flare. We went a couple days ago, and my boyfriend got the fire chicken, which he said is now on his list of Top 5 chicken dishes haha. He also got chili, which he said was also delicious. I, being a vegetarian, got the potato swirl- one of the tastiest forms of potato I've ever had- and the tofu "wings"- lightly fried squares with sauce. Everything was spicy, flavorful, and delicious. I also loved that they had vegetarian options. Prices are moderate, and expect a wait as they get busy, especially on weekends. Look for a seat at the bar, or give your phone number and they'll call you when it's your turn for a table. It's a fun and high energy place that everyone who visits charlotte should definitely check out. Service was also extremely quick, and everyone was friendly! 10/10 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. The potato swirl, with spicy mayo dipping sauce

V2Ol4kIaEwVj9nAf1sFduw.text: Sooooo good!   We've been here a few times and it's really a great combo of east meets west.   For starters, you can't leave here without the kimchi fries. It's like a Korean version of a poutine. This can be a meal all it's own or split it with a friend if you are feeling generous.   The fire chicken is off the hook. I don't think it is exactly worthy of the term "fire" as far as spicy, but the grill flavor might be the goal of the name. The huge portion of five thighs for $9 (small) is more than a main course.   Other items I've tried are the tacos and pork belly. The pork belly is pricy but it's something really special. The hard crunch is really impressive since the meat is still really moist and juicy.   The space is pretty loud and this is speaking from the lunch rush. The food comes out as it is ready so the spacing of meals at a full table can be a little awkward.   The staff is always willing to explain items on the menu. They are quick to fill drinks and help when they can.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi fries

LRgqqqMLg05yrC8HR8DSoA.text: Went on a Saturday night. The wait was about an hour. Two bars you can attempt to hang around while waiting. The noise level is loud. Lots of college aged people. Outside area for dogs. Beer pong tables. Karaoke rooms. None of this bothered me except eating outside = a lot of flies which I didn't consider.   Had some frose which was delicious and a nice way to cool off. For my meal I had yummy watermelon lemonade to drink, their baf wings in sweet and mild and soy garlic, fat brisket bulgogi taco, pork belly spring roll, and bulgogi kim bap. Yes I had a lot. Lol. This was my first time here so I wanted to try everything. The meat in all of my dishes was cooked deliciously and very tender.   I honestly loved it all. The wings were so big and saucy. They were cooked well and crispy. The taco was yum I loved the aoli. The kim bap was nice and bite sized. The prices are pretty affordable. Definitely recommend this place if you want something different and might feel like stepping out of your comfort zone with some cool asian fusion. Also, if you don't mind a wait on a weekend.   Oh and also the service was great everyone I came across was really nice .

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

KZ8qWrF-aGyi_05Mb85yQA.text: Seoul's Food is different than any Korean BBQ place you have ever been and that's what draws people to the restaurant in packs.  Pros: - The wings are delicious and the flavors are by far some of the best in the city  - The food comes our immediately, so the food is nice and hot when it arrives to your table - Their is a plethora of authentic Korean beers and cocktails that lend to the atmosphere - Rentable Karaoke rooms for you and a group if you want to eat, drink, and sing your heart out  Cons: - Parking is limited , with a few spots actually on the location - R.I.P - Thursday, late night sides.  ProTip: Try the Ramen Mac and Cheese and the Kimchi Fries during their 4-7 happy hour Monday -Thursday

BKHevx22SAbmSanHjcsO7Q.text: been two weeks since my visit, shame on me for delaying!  this place is great.  "wings" were the size of a ufc fist ready to punch amazing flavor down your windpipe.  service was on point, very helpful for a first-timer and bonus points for laughing at my bad jokes.  will absolutely visit again (soon)

PAuyd5mL-D4hTYfpZe_gxA.text: The best place you'll probably eat at. We always get the beef ribs, then get as many sides as we want! The sides are $1 Monday - Thursday from 4:30-5:30 so it's even better, and it's not too packed inside. The food comes out very fast, and is hot and delicious. My favorite sides are the philly steak and cheese egg rolls, pimento corn cheese with shrimp chips, and ramen Mac n cheese. A MUST try

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. $1 sides
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. $1 sides Mon-Thur 4:30-5:30 pm.

o1z7UZAFt7z_IVwCP4R7Nw.text: I'm not really sure what the appeal of Seoul is to so many people, everything I have had there in the past has been okay at best, and with them raising their prices everytime I have gone, it has gotten harder to justify trying it again.  The last time I went we got the vegetarian Tofu option for the wings. I can say without doubt the worst thing I have ordered in a long time. It's just 6 pieces of what appears to be store bought tofu you could find for $2 anywhere, but instead it is covered in sauce and is nearly $10.   No thanks Seoul, plenty of alternatives in South end

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu wings

mpiZgh5BJVsHrKt18WzCPA.text: My other and I come here every so often and really like it a lot. We generally hang at the bar outside. The food is really great - the staff could use some work. Overall we always have pleasant experiences and will return.

krzJnf8eNvMsGArQj28dIg.text: This place has a lot going on. For starters their food is fantastic. They only have two flavors of wings but they do them both really well and the spicy wings sure pack some heat. The pork and fire chicken both come in large portions so even ordering a small will get you a lot of food and a couple small orders along with some apps can easily be split by a small to medium sized group. Out back they have a great deck for drinking with buddies complete with corn hole, beer pong, and even a gaited dog park. I've regularly dined here and have always had great service. Finally the private karaoke rooms are a blast whether you are there for a special occasion or just a night out with friends but make sure to book well in advance.

oUo3UB76fsN6e4vVXoJE5w.text: JUST GO! So creative & tasty & quixotic & lovely & local. Ramen mac n cheese FTW but everything was fantastic.

QGu9GVYVc4I22tCc2lEqFg.text: I've been to Let's Meat next door and was very impressed with that so my expectation for Seoul Food Meat Company was very high!  And it went above and beyond. I love the concept of southern and Korean fusion. The waitress explained the system (family style, kind of like dim sum) and answered all my questions about the sides. The food came out really fast - and I was impressed with all of the dishes. The crispy pork belly was very tasty, not too crunchy and very flavorful. As a filipino who grew up with lechon kawali - this is probably one of the best crispy pork belly I've had. The green tea cornbread was so good, moist and you could definitely taste the green tea. The kimchi chili ramen was surprisingly delicious as well. The egg rolls and spring rolls were both on point, very crispy and flavorful.   I loved it so much I was tempted to come back after our show nearby just to come back for their happy hour for their $1 sides after 10pm. I would seriously consider just driving to Charlotte (1.5 hours away) just to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green tea cornbread
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy pork belly, green tea cornbread, kimchi ramen chili

_zupe3lL8uokZDjjS5SPjw.text: This is a pretty trendy food joint, offering Korean inspired dishes but with a twist. I had the fire chicken with the kimchi slaw. I had the small order and it was all that I could do to finish 3/4 of it. I would say the portion size you could possibly even split. To drink I had a $3 Sapporo and an apple Soju. They serve the Soju in a interesting fashion, a bar mixing cup that is over flowing with a fog of goodness! I'm assuming they use dry ice for this effect. I will definitely return next time I'm in town and suggest others do the same!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Soju.... so good!
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soju menu
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire chicken with Kimchi slaw.

OaCK7nPmj_57nfI77LpWlg.text: Nice laid back atmosphere, service was friendly and fast. I gave only 3stars because there wasn't anything I particularly liked that had my taste buds dancing . Was the food good, yes , everything was prepared well but I just think I can't appreciate the Korean fusion cuisine.    I did like the sign on the door that stated "We are not a traditional Korean restaurant " lol. I even asked for chopsticks and it was a flat no, we don't have them . The foodie in me ordered a lot bc I wanted to try different stuff but it was a lot of food . Meats are a Lil pricey and sides you order separately at $4 a pop but you get plenty so it balances out.   I feel my Fried pork skins were a Lil too hard and lacked flavor unless I dipped them in the chili oil.  The green tea muffin I ordered it so my 2yr old would have something to munch on but he didn't like it , I tasted it and it was good just different.  The soy deviled eggs, hmmmm ... if you like soy sauce flavor go for it! Koreans use soy sauce in almost everything.  The kimchi coleslaw was my favorite , I should've ordered rice and just killed that. The bulgogi tacos were the winner , simple, flavorful , and decent size . Also it's the only thing the toddler, teen, and father ate .  I can see why this restaurant is popular , offering Korean flare to American style dishes . I would take a newbie foodie here to ease into the taste of Korean cooking.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. soy deviled eggs
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. fried pork belly
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. bulgogi tacos

a6aXrmCW3YMFHqCR2C8oPw.text: I love the concept and how all the meats are put on a tray to be shared with the table. I LOVE their sides especially the Kimchi fries. The deviled eggs are okay, I wouldn't get them again. However, the crispy pork belly is disappointing. I definitely will not get them again. They were too chewy and too salty. They do look so good though. I really like the chicken wings, even though I think they are a wee bit salty. I think they would be fine if you eat the radish with them, but I don't like radish so I just ate them alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly, fire chicken, kimchee fries, soy deviled eggs

9T_WyqCwt-xgJxNsbrDf6g.text: Omgoodness this place is fantastic. We got the pulled pork, bao buns (amazing), potato swirl (which is a skewered potato sprinkled with sriracha seasoning), kimchi slaw and what's called not a sushi roll.   Our waiter Abstraxxx is amazing! Fantastic recommendations and is passionate about his art and the offerings at this amazing (have I said amazing enough?!) restaurant.   I'm from Socal so eating good is my passion and I would totally recommend this place!

I8bohxf8PG2zw7lT7m41rw.text: For all you meat lovers this is the place for you. It's cute, fast and good. Make no mistake, bring your appetite. I'm not a heavy beef or pork eater but I wanted to get in on this new sensation. While it didn't disappoint, it was too heavy for me. But I can say that the Pork Belly and BbQ Ribs were outstanding. You'll need plenty of water if you get the meat platter. Short of giving it a five star is because the "strongest" cocktail there was not strong at all. And I'm a cocktail having Woman with my meal. The sides are a la carte, which is good so you can create your own meal. The game area is so cool with its kickball pool. Oh and it's dog friendly(the game area)

kRklNGxeb07-JI5iTbGUAg.text: So this review is for two things. The food and the karaoke room.  I haven't had too much off the menu besides the wings. They are just so good it's hard to order anything else. They are huge and a little goes a long way. Try both flavors, you won't regret it. They offer a large selection of alcohol with interesting flavors,so be adventures.  Now the karaoke room. I threw a surprise party in the Rockstar room one Friday night.  They said the room holds 25-27, but unless it's children size people, keep it under 25. There's room, it's just cramped.we had  20 and it was perfect. It was hot in there and we had to constantly request for the air to be turned on. We had to keep opening the door so we could stop sweating. Eventually after we keep propping the door opened, they turned it on. Now the karaoke machine is all in Korean -_- .. i wasn't around for instructions, but everybody said it was complicated. Luckily we found one person who could somewhat figure it it. Unfortunately it def took time, figuring out how to find each song,out of our paid 2 hours.  They have a call button which really didn't make the server come in the room quicker. Food and alcohol came out in a timely manner. The karaoke itself had a decent selection of songs. The best part is that it's scored at the end of each performance. Makes it competitive. Overall i will definitely rent a room again, it was so much fun!! They also have different rooms for different size groups and special prices sometimes on a weekday!

AFQRTb1JiBdNj6D6Z6Ng2A.text: Came here with a group on a Sunday night. Thought it may take a while but they served us right away. We had two servers for group which helped to expedite the service. We order the beef brisket and it was so good. The meat was cooked to perfection. It melted in our mouth and the sauce was tangy but sweet, not overly one or the other. The BBQ blend went well with the meat. We added some sides like kimchee, rice and tofu. They all went well together. We left full and definitely satisfied. Next time, I want to try their fries and sushi that's "not sushi", it all looked so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some yummy melt in your mouth brisker
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Team dinner

PGAIZg0Xe8AwmxmGP1li5Q.text: This place is AMAZING!! If you're looking for Korean BBQ with Southern flair this place is for you! We are not from the area so we definitely crave this restaurant since there is nothing like it up North.   We had the beef rib which is really tasty and the sauce is delicious! Our recent time had a lot more fat than meat on it but it was still really great!  We also had the fire chicken which has a great amount of cheese on top of it!! It's not spicy but when you add the sauce which comes on the side, it certainly is hot! We also had the pulled pork which was really delicious and probably my favorite out of all of them but they are all so tasty!! We also ordered ramen mac and cheese which is delicious of course! I do wish the side was larger since we shared among 4 people. The potato swirl is delicious and the sauce is great but it is spicy too! The soy pickled deviled eggs are delicious especially if you like soy! We also green tomato kimchi which is really good and not spicy! This place serves food fast and service is good. We did have an error as they brought out pork belly in error which remained on our receipt but then took it off when they realized it.  I think they also have Sapporo on draft!  If you're in Charlotte and looking for a great place to try with tons of meat and unique dishes - come check it out! You won't regret it!

Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire chicken with the ramen mac and cheese and green tomato kimchi
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ramen mac and cheese

8Y2jyeQEm3K4bkKnQLmgfQ.text: The flavors, bbq/Korean fusion style food, and family style servings make this place a favorite.   You can't go wrong with anything but the wings, pork belly, and fire chicken stand out for meats and the ramen Mac, Bao buns, and deviled eggs are great for sides.   This is a great casual place to enjoy with co-workers, friends or family.

uBMTsl1OF-DOL-KGB2AlKg.text: Excellent service. Even more excellent food. What more can you ask for?  We ordered the deviled egg, wings, ribs (buns are a must), coleslaw, dirty rice. I highly recommend everything we ordered. All the food came out promptly and super delicious. It's 5 hours after my meal there and I'm still drooling at the thought of the ribs sandwiched between the baos and that dirty rice...so yummy! I would eat here everyday if I lived here.   This place is definitely a very unique concept. I would agree it's southern BBQ with an Asian twist. My co-worker and I flew into Charlotte for a work meeting and stopped by for lunch. We walked out full and happy. We even boxed up the leftovers to continue the feast back at our hotel rooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entire meal was yummy. The ribs (don&#39;t forget the buns), dirty rice and wings are a must try!

W_YS-uEiY-H_3ehd3BJgtg.text: I wanted to like this place, so. bad. The menu sounded delicious, and I usually trust a 4 star rating on Yelp. Not so much here. First of all, parking is a mess, skip the lot and try to find street parking. When we arrived we were greeted with a very loud room. Like, be prepared to scream at each other to be heard. The host told us they had a "really long wait" but no timeframe. They take your number and are very clear if you don't pick up they move on. I get it, you're getting people in and out, but be a little softer in your approach. (Much like other reviews on here around reservations.) I felt like I was in trouble and I'd been there two minutes. We decided to grab a drink at the bar, nearly impossible inside, so we wandered outside. My margarita was really delicious and my boyfriend opted for a local beer. When we finally got seated (about an hour wait) no one came to serve us. Not until we were making remarks and another waiter heard us, did someone come over. He proceeded to tell us he wasn't our server but he'd figure it out. Finally a girl shows up who doesn't apologize, says she will bring us waters and runs off. We were actually ready to order since we'd sat so long. When she returned, no waters in hand, we ordered and my boyfriend asked for another beer, holding up his can. The next time she comes by, no beer, no water. He asks again. Second time, she brings a jalapeno beer that was not what he was drinking, when she's told it's the wrong one, she asks if he'd rather have that one. Nope. I ordered a beer, she asked if I wanted to sample it, after our food arrives she gives me the sample, so I declined the purchase. We ordered the wings (half and half) the brisket, and the ramen Mac. The ramen Mac was uninspired and tasted like throwing velveeta on spaghetti noodles. The brisket was dry. The wings, were both delicious. So, if I return it will be to grab wings to go. This place lacks service all around, clearly you're doing well so it seems that there's this attitude towards the customer of "we don't need you, so get over it."

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

EQbL_LCxX_8tAqZHNMFrJQ.text: What an awesome find in Charlotte! Coming from LA which is a mecca for Korean cuisine outside of Korea itself, it was a very pleasant surprise to find fusion of American barbecue and Korean flavors at Seoul Food.   The (giant) beef rib had a hint of Korean flavors--don't forget the dipping sauce! While both flavors of the wings were good, I did like the soy garlic better. I took them back to the hotel on the first night, and they stayed crispy in spite of the travel.   The tilapia is served whole fish preparation style, I absolutely recommend even if you're squeamish at the sight of the head. There's an Asian glaze on the fish which makes the facial features less distinct, and the flavors are definitely worth the adventure...plus you can't beat the $14 price tag!   The bulgogi taco was also delish...can be a nice appetizer while waiting for your main event. The service was also very good. Gabby helped us the first night and she was great. Simon helped us the second day, andhe was good too. Sara came up and introduced herself to us; I think she may be a co-owner or manager.  This place is definitely a favorite in Charlotte...I do hope they expand all the way to LA! I can't wait to come back!

Pmb_BCTi8JDus3fNUuL7FA.text: I don't quite get all the hype about this place.   I met a friend for dinner and lucky for us there were other yelpers there who had already ordered so we could see some of the goodies they tried...and they shared their sriracha cracklins with us! So nice! Also, probably the highlight of the meal.   I thought we did a good job ordering a variety of stuff but overall I just left underwhelmed.  Here's the run down:  Sriracha Cracklins - Great way to start the meal. Loved them!   Potato Swirl - Pretty good. I liked whatever the coating was on them.  It's definitely an interesting take on a crispy potato.   Half and Half Wings - These were good, but not great. There was a lot of breading. If that's not your thing...skip them.   Crispy Pork Belly - These could have been better - they came out very dry. Not sure if that's normal or we just got a bad batch.   Smashed Potato Salad - No. Just no. It was very runny and I'm still not sure all of what was exactly in it.   Sausage - I forget the name of it but it was the sweeter version of the two options. Not my favorite.   Also, our service was just okay. Our waiter kinda rushed us through ordering and didn't really explain all the menu items. So that was a bit of a letdown. And then when we said we didn't like the food, seemed a bit confused and sent another waitress over?!   Eventually, the manager came over and apologized an asked for our feedback on what we liked and didn't like so that was a very nice touch. He seemed to really want to get our input to make the food better! But by that point I was pretty much over it.   So...Am I glad I gave them a try? Yes. Will I be running back for a second visit? No thanks.

Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

z-5bj6DhLW_OYdaYZvMVnQ.text: Check out Wingman Collier Seoul Food Meat Co video wing review on Facebook & YouTube. Search Wingman Collier. Please post to your website & Facebook in addition to sharing.  Keep the Wing Train  Rolling and Enjoy Life One Wing at a Time!!!

gf2p7NNKSt0hJcqyNpbHog.text: We arrived in town late, and this is one of the few places that was still open near our hotel.  When we came here at 1:00 a..m., the host informed us that the kitchen was only open for 30 more minutes.  I previously worked in the restaurant industry, and I know it can be frustrating when people walk in at the last minute when you are about to close.  I actually felt sorry for our waiter, but he had an attitude of us being his first customers of the day.  Excellent service at such a late hour!  The kimchi taco on the left was was definitely vegan. The sriracha cracklings were gluten friendly, and the brisket taco was my cheat dish.  Who says you can't eat a balanced diet after 1:00 a.m. when you are on the road.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

-gc49WeO5w1Lh8HAZoUTlA.text: So legit! I'm so glad my homies took me here. Come here with a bunch of people so you can order the entire F'n menu. Everything was so good. The brisket was to die for. Wow! I don't even use that phrase but I just did. Lol. Anyways, it was super tender and the large portion right on the bone was enough for 4 people to share with left overs. If you have a dog, they'll love you too (just make sure you bring the bone home).   Speaking of dogs... this place is good for pets since they have a nice outdoor area with games, etc... Very fun atmosphere. If you want to sing, they got karaoke rooms for that too.

E4zrp_fxYxp_UBo9hsgpng.text: lots of good reviews for this place and i can see why. we went on a wednesday night and we still had to wait (even tho it was literally 2 minutes) for a table to vacate to sit.  we ordered the $23 beef rib, the soy garlic wings, and the potato tornado (potato twist? idk what its called here lol) The beef rib was rich, meaty, fall off the bone tender. I enjoyed the dipping sauce, but the meat itself didn't have the DEEP smoky flavor i was looking for. still worth the $23 purchase though. This came with so much meat that i would consider subbing another entree for this. We had to take home a chunk of this. The soy garlic wings were good, nice and crunchy, and the pieces themselves were very large. a 6 piece quantity was enough to share between two and was very filling. the potato tornado on a stick was my favorite! i loved getting this on the streets of asia and was happy to see this here. it was dusted with a chili powder and served with a spicy dipping sauce; it was fried so that the outside was lightly crispy and the inside was thin yet soft. my favorite part of our meal. Looks like if you went at like 4-5pm or something like that all sides are a tiny price. all food came out VERY quick. waitress was prompt and checked up on us often and gave good recommendations on what to order and how much. just like next door at let's meat, the entire staff/host/everyone was very friendly and greeted us as we walked in and out.  i left this place feeling very heavy and fatty (but that's okay!) and so just a little bit here filled me up pretty quick and didn't kill my wallet. definitely worth a spot to visit when visiting NC. Surprised to find this here but i'm glad it exists!

YPJYPJ9g-I6kbAzID5JOJw.text: Great, fun atmosphere. Outside you can play soccer pool, huge Jenga, beer pong and a couple other fun drinking games. We got the wings and they were HUGE. They did have a lot of breading on them and both sauces were very sweet. I wish they would've had more sauce options. Nonetheless they were delicious. Me and my boyfriend wanted to share 10 but instead we each got 10 which was way too much. We wish the server would've read our order back to us to ensure she got the correct order. We were staying at a hotel so couldn't take our leftovers which was 11 wings. I would go back for the atmosphere and just order something else.

QjO89zIItV5mhw7v0dgE2A.text: First time here and it was great! Our waitress briefly explained the background of the restaurant, the menu, and warned us that the food comes as its ready (it literally did). I hate an overwhelming menu, so I liked the simplicity of it and the fact that there are only two flavor options for the wings. Both flavors are so good. Who doesn't love garlic or spicy bbq?  Me and my bf ordered wings, collard greens, and the sweet potato birds nest (really good).  Within 5 minutes literally....our greens were at the table. & the other dishes soon followed. EVERYTHING WAS FRESH! The wings were good, double fried so I didn't have to request them to be extra crispy, as I usually request this.  The sweet potato nest is a pretty dope side item, topped with cinnamon and honey. Mmmmm! I did tell the waitress that it'd be cool of they served it with chopsticks.  Anyway, you guys should try !

hHnPjbkPaOgemq4su7-YwA.text: My first visit to Charlotte and Seoul Food was the best rated place near where I was staying. Came for lunch so wasn't crowded at all and got a table right away. Somewhat industrial/rustic decor with K-pop playing on the TV screens.   My husband looves their beernog - that's correct, it's a stout topped with eggnog. Interesting concept. Also interesting that a lot of their beer selection is actually Hitachino (Japanese), but I'm counting that as a positive because I dig their beers.  Now food, everything is pretty much served family style on a big platter in front of you. The husband tried to convince me that 1/2 of meat is not a lot and we had to order several things. Trust me it's not trivial... We couldn't finish a bunch of stuff at the end.  Kimchi BBQ pork ribs - My favorite of the bunch. Very tender ribs and got a nice spicy kick to it.  Bulgogi sausage - Can't say I could have picked out the bulgogi flavor in a blind tasting but it was good.  Crispy pork belly - The most disappointing part of the meal. The fat was an overwhelming portion of the serving (I say going on 70%) and the skin was difficult to chew on majority of pieces. I ended up just picking off the small pieces of meat and left all the rest to waste.  Broccoli - The healthy part of our meal. It was more or less steamed broccoli with gochujang on top, no idea why my husband was such a big fan.  Potato swirl - This was excellent! It takes art (or a nice machine) to cut the potato this way. Each piece you pull off is very thin but crispy on the outside and I really like whatever seasoning it is they put on it.  Overall, had a good meal and it was certainly a fun concept fusing southern BBQ with Korean flavors. Seeing other reviews, looks like the dishes are really hit or miss. And if you order the "correct" or better items will define your experience here.
