Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi Fries

5flVF140NQRi8DoGR2mymw.text: Wow.  Best meal I've had in recent memory.    This place has quite a reputation in Charlotte, and it turns out it's all for good reason.  We believed the hype, and knew we hard to give it a try after first trying its neighboring restaurant, Let's Meat.    We weren't able to park (surprise surprise for Friday night in South End), and were told that they couldn't quote us a wait time due to there being 15 people on the wait list.  We said this was fine and waited at the local brewery, Wooden Robot, also incredible.   We were seated faster than expected (around 30-45 mins altogether).  We opted for the following:  -Crispy Pork belly (small order) -Half and half wings (small) -deviled eggs -kimchi fries -kimchi pork taco.    Everything was amazing.  The wings were by far the best.  Crispy, perfectly fried and deliciously sauced. We did the half and half to try both, but would definitely get all soy garlic next time.  The kimchi fries came second, delicious and also perfectly fried.  The meat was good, though not as good as Let's Meat in terms of marination/seasoning.  The taco and deviled eggs are definitely items you would be better off replacing with something else on the menu -- good, but not knockouts like the rest.    The price is INCREDIBLY reasonable.  For all of the above was $40, and way more than enough food.  With $1 sides Monday-Thursday, Seoul Food is more than fair on price.    Overall, this place is amazing, as evidenced by how busy it always is.  Make it your next stop in South End.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

26nQGU7tf9Rhzh4fdpdNag.text: This is not the restaurant for you if you don't want some filling southern style food.  Seoul describes itself as a southern style restaurant with a Korean spin and it is comfort food perfected! The soy garlic wings are a must, I typically can't eat more than 3.  Also a huge fan or the fire chicken.  For sides I tend to stick with the Philly cheesesteak egg roll which is very tender and cheesy, and the kimchi fries which are enough to share! Have liked everything I've tried, the only thing I was lukewarm about was the sweet potato birds nest which was a little difficult to eat.

ty62j1_W4nJRt7kAnAFEvg.text: Oh my Lord. I don't eat  meat normally, but I smelled my husband's beef ribs and I went for it. Holy cow! Get in my belly!

CU_SJ5WnVtz8hE7Qikz80w.text: Some of my foodie friends and I met up for lunch since most of us were off of work today. We came in as soon as they opened and were quickly seated. Our server throughly explained the process of how they serve food.  We all ordered THE WINGS!! Omg! My faves are the soy garlic. So flavorful. I also ordered the the Philly bulgogi egg rolls and the fried fish taco. The taco was a little underwhelming as I felt like it was missing a spice or sauce, idk. The egg rolls were pretty tasty (sans the dipping sauce as I do not like mustard). Oh and I tried my friend's ram n cheese (baked ramen "Mac n cheese' and it was surprisingly good!  Of course I will back Bc wings duh! The crispy pork belly is on my list for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small soy garlic wings
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried fish taco

0A6QD9CmnM8EZQrL6PT_5A.text: I went there on a Thursday night because this Charlotte Agenda article says they have $1 side from 10pm to 1am (charlotteagenda.com/1580...) but the manager just says "oh we changed the policy" but she couldn't answer where they posted or advertised the change in their policy. They wouldn't even comp just for the once night so this will be the last time I dine their.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charlotte Agenda Article

bh3UIIl5WH25Mv-vexEtmQ.text: This is always my favorite place to take friends when they're in town!  The atmosphere, while loud (K Pop blasting) and tight with seating, is still inviting. Once you get your food you won't even be bothered by the noise!  I usually just like to order a bunch of things and share since it's small plate style.   The wings are of course my favorite! Just so delicious.  Portions are huge! The pork rinds are made in house. They literally kept popping/sizzling HOURS after leaving the restaurant. Kinda weird, but at least they were tasty.   The collard greens had a surprisingly good flavor.   Philly egg rolls...delicious!   Go and just order a bunch of stuff!!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

KBGRf3URGJwtGWvgHywxaw.text: I've been hearing good things about this place. My foodie friends decided to try this place for lunch on President's Day. There was no wait and they sat us right away. The environment was friendly and casual. our sever wasn't extremely vibrate but he we got our food out in a timely manner and he was cordial. The wings are HUGE and only come in two flavors ; soy garlic and spicy bbq. I like hot stuff so the spicy bbq was my favorite but my friends all picked the soy garlic . They weren't bad just not my favorite. I ordered a small which was 6 wings and honestly it's enough because they are really big. Makes me wonder what kind of hormones are they putting in them birds lol. I also had the fish tacos and they lacked favor. It needed some seasoning and more sauce. Overall I enjoyed it and I'll be back.  Parking is limited during the day, but there is street parking.

tvjoDmrz0e5y7w-lvSR6Nw.text: This was my first visit to Seoul Food Meat Company. Our waitress knew this as well. She highly recommended The BAF Wings. My boyfriend wanted the Kimchi Fries. We ordered the medium order is winds, half soy garlic, half spicy BBQ.   The wings came out immediately somewhat warm. The fries arrived about 10 minutes later. When I questioned whether or not the wings were prepared to order, I was told yes and that the fries take longer...  The wings were as hard as a rock. The waitress did not offer to bring out another order. So I ordered a Fried Fish Taco while my boyfriend finished the Rock hard wings and cold fries (oh yeah, they didn't come out hot either.   The waitress came to our table twice while we waited on my one fish taco asking if we were good... I told her I'd let her know when I got my taco. We waited another 20 minutes for my taco. My boyfriend finally asked for the check and to cancel the order for the taco. At the same time the one fish taco arrives at the table yep you guessed it COLD!! We sent it back.   The owner then returns to the table with the taco asking if there was a problem. I explained the issues with the food. She then began to explain how they prepare their food. I again explanted that the food was not fresh. She then simply said fine and walked off.   Had the customer service been better I would have considered returning. However, I will NEVER go there again.

LLgfpxsKLqBUqMnjV_QdIQ.text: I love love love this restaurant.  I went with my friends who live here while I was in town and The waitress was very knowledgeable about their food and drink products.  She recommended the yogurt and pineapple soju so we got both. Then we ordered a bunch of sides and it was well worth it. My most favorite was the sweet potato bird nest and my friends loved the kimchi fries. We had such a great time and I absolutely enjoyed catching up and spending time with them at a friendly establishment. I can't wait to come back to Charlotte just to come here!

_du2tcYUZtdZwCVP4lgWRA.text: I don't normally like wings but I could eat this place's wings every day of my life and be happy. They have such good flavor and are so crispy! Highly recommend. I also got the kimchi fries and they were amazing, one friend that had been here previously said that may be the best side they have.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi fries

7Mlvzfsnl8lel4E5yVzxWA.text: I wish this place was in Florida too, it's great!  Some restaurants will add Asian flavors to American food but it's never that memorable but this restaurant has really succeeded.   Most of the dishes were small, so we ordered several, but the wings were big and meaty, unlike some wings at other restaurants.   My favorites were the shrimp chips with pimento cheese and ramen mac & cheese. My husband and son said the tacos were fantastic!  I was disappointed with the kimbap. I've had better at Korean supermarkets.   Unfortunately, we will not be returning to Charlotte anytime soon, so I'll have to try to duplicate some of the dishes I ordered.

LMNg3Oc540GwHNYeOj00DA.text: The food is amazing, enough said about that.  The drinks? Over priced and weak. My group was told about the Pineapple drink. We were told it was meant for 4-6 people and it was a load of crap. Weakest drink I've ever had and barely any alcohol in it. Go for the food, lower your expectations as low as possible for the drinks and you should have a 5 star review.

IwjfijJYoC3skb8i2KZQNg.text: I have been here over 10 times and I will keep coming back!  A few weeks ago, Kevin was out server on Saturday evening and he was AMAZING! He had a great cheery attitude and he really took care of us. My go to is the fire chicken that I put into bao bun! That is after I eat about 5 wings! Both flavors are great. These wings are huge!   I also recently went on a Wednesday for their $1 sides from 4:30-5:30. Yes, $1 sides- that means deviled eggs, ramen mac and cheese, potato spiral, etc. And the best thing of them all the kimchi fries!!  Victoria P. was awesome! We were seated outside and she took such good care of us!  You have to love this place! Plenty of games outside, small dog run and karaoke rooms! It gets busy on the weekends, so be prepared   And my most recent $1 app visit was Tuesday and David, our server was awesome! I tried something new, the pimento corn cheese appetizer. This is a game changer! 1. It's a large side and shareable 2. The chip things are so different and just melts in your mouth 3. It's amazing!   It looks like some upgrades and remodeling is happening on the back deck. It looks good so far!  Like I said, I'll keep coming back! Love this place!

lmJOAsn-f2ov1UAhtF3GDg.text: I love this place! I make it a must visit location any time I'm in CLT. I like spicy flavorful food and this checks both boxes... if you happen to come for happy hour it's even better... for just $1 you can try any of the appetizers... I wasn't sure about the green tea corn bread but for $1 I tried it and loved it! The chicken wings are larger then the normal "bar food hot wings" I prefer the spicy over the garlic but you can't go wrong. Baked ram n cheese is awesome... think mac n cheese using ramen noodles... spring rolls are one of a kind... this place will fill you up... such a great value!

-6HCots7ifjAJjjxlsFmhQ.text: Came here for a date night. I was nervous trying this restaurant but was optimistic due to the good reviews.   When you come to this restaurant be prepared to wait because it is extremely popular. They won't give you a wait time but will tell you how many parties are in front of you. I did not like that because, i rather her have a range of what time I'll be seated. However we waited maybe 20 minutes for our table, which isn't bad.  Our waitress was decent. She was able to answer our questions but after we ordered we rarely saw her. I truly forgot what she looked like because she did not really come back our way.  Everything is a la carte and comes out when it is ready. Meaning all your food won't come out at once. We ordered the rum punch( too sweet), jumbo wings, ramen Mac and cheese, fish tacos, kimchee fries, and philly egg rolls. I could of gone without the ramen but everything else was so good.   The best part the restaurant is extremely affordable( the egg rolls were around $5 for 2).   Everyone needs to try this place at least once

ttAoWJrgruyUeMBavWPpQQ.text: This is not a traditional Korean restaurant- actually that is their disclaimer prior to entering.   Most of the dishes are "Korean inspired" bar food. They're known for the chicken wings or meats and sides such as kimchi fries. And they do Korean/American southern bbq very well. Located close to the university, I was immediately turned on by the trendy vibe here. It's a fun place to hang out and have a hand crafted cocktail. Our wings were flavorful and juicy. Our server explained everything perfectly and even gave some recommendations that we happily tried. This is definitely a place I would return to.

AmarONTimq0AMrTKUdFgBQ.text: Came here on a Tues evening during there $1 side Happy Hour and basically ate my way through their menu.  I sat at the bar and was promptly tended to by the nice bartender. She informed me that in addition to their $1 sides they currently had half-off draft beers. I knew I was going to be getting 5-6 sides, so I went with a light Sapporo for $2.   I ordered the deviled eggs, which came out lightning fast and were flavorful and shockingly filling! I also go the bulgogi & porkbelly egg rolls, which were good, but lacking in the meats. The dipping sauces they came with were so good, though! I got the Ramen mac n cheese chili and had this with the green tea cornbread. The gt cb is incredible, but when paired with the Ramen mnc chili, it is next level! The  Ramen mnc chili was really good as the ramen mac is under the chili and when mixed gives fantastic flavor + texture! I finished my sides tour de force with the sweet potato birds nest. This thing is massive and definitely made to be shared! The crunch and sweet potato w/the brown sugar/cinnamon was great and it was a nice end to the meal.   I ended up adding another Sapporo to the mix and when all was said and done w/tax & tip, my total was $14. For sure, one of the best HH in CrownTown!  They do have a parking lot and street parking did not seem to be a problem that time of day on a weekday. Staff were friendly and the food was brought out in order ordered and quickly. I even loved the Korean music vids they had playing.  I will definitely be back to explore more of their main menu and try even more their sides!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

7YOL_EyaybXlvxLuIEurkA.text: This place is bizarre and cool at the same time. When you walk in you are greeted with the sound of K-POP jamming on the speakers and may even get a glimpse on the TVs scattered around the room. Once your seated the menu may seem a little confusing, however our server did an amazing job explaining everything. If you come here order the wings, they are incredible delicious and crispy. They only have two flavours soy garlic and spicy bbq, but they both are delicious so order both. We also ordered pulled pork with buns, Mac n cheese ramen, and cracklings which had a spicy dusting on them. I had to wash that delicious food down with a nice cold draft Sapporo.  I must say what I really enjoyed about this place besides the great atmosphere, is that the food is served family style and it comes out very quick as a small plates restaurant. I am definitely coming back to try some more amazing food and maybe take some pictures next time(I was too hungry and forgot to snap a pic of the food).

EBiRHyOb5yjHOOnhnwkM_Q.text: Well, just got into Charlotte for the weekend for a wedding. A nice and tiring 7 hour plus drive because of all the traffic on 77 coming in. Checked into the hotel absolutely starving. At 8 PM, most things are closing so options were a bit limited. I almost just settled for ordering in pizza but decided to Yelp the area a bit first. Seoul Food came up on the first page. Read some of the reviews suggesting that it was a nice fusion between Asia and good ol' fashioned comfort food. I decided 4 stars on Yelp was worth dragging by sorry butt out of bed and make the drive out.   At first, I thought I was in the wrong area. Then you see this building well lit. The outdoor areas had a dog park (AMAZING!), corn hole (or bags if that's what you call it), pool with soccer balls, and a nice outdoor seating area. Walked in and the ambience just screamed clean with a hip vibe. Sat at the bar (eating solo and felt less lame that way haha). The service was quick. Bartender was knowledgeable about beer selection and made great suggestions based on your likes. I ordered the pork belly, kimchi fries, and green tea corn bread...a bit ambitious, I know. The food was out within minutes. Being Asian, I'm really picky about my roasted pork since that's a staple in our diet. Their's was spot on. Skin had the nice crisp and chewiness that is iconic. The meat was juicy with a nice char on the outside. If I had one comment, it would just be that the meat was lukewarm when brought out to me. Not cold by any means but just not with that warmth that I grew up with. The corn bread was on point. Nice crunch on the top, soft and moist inside with a perfect hint of green tea that by no means overpowered the taste of the corn. The kimchi fries...how do I even begin? The fries were fries...nothing to blow you away. But the toppings...wow. Kimchi with some mayo aioli and a layer of bugolgi. This absolutely made it. I would definitely come back to this joint to try the other items on the menu.

nd7iK3eamV0AF0FhE6Whlw.text: I literally cannot SING the praises of Seoul Food enough!  My friends and I visited on two separate occasions last month, one of which included utilizing one of their amazing Karaoke Rooms, and another just me and my husband for some dinner. WOW!  The food here is incredible.  I wouldn't necessarily say this is traditional Korean food, but I would say that its so delicious and doesn't even matter! The wings are out of this world delicious, as is the Ram & Cheese, the deviled eggs and the tacos! I would pass on the broccoli if it were me!  The Karaoke rooms are rented by the hour, they do not take reservations, but its a FUN time for a large group to sing with their friends only.

GSsOoXX9rwpAVshBlIb4vQ.text: This is such a cute place with such a chill vibe.   I had the wings and ramen Mac and potato swirl.  I gave them a 4 Bc the sides were extremely unique but they weren't my favorite.   But those wings though! AMAZING! Nice and crisp on the outside but still moist. The flavor, soy garlic, was great!!!   I'll definitely be returning!!

Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato swirl

LaAPqWcbyxRFAj5zZtka3Q.text: I really love this place! Everytime I come to Charlotte, I make a point to stop by. They have a really cool selection including things like Ramen noodles as a Mac + Cheese but items like the crispy pork belly, fire wings and yogurt soju keep me coming back. Super authentic like what you could find in bars/eateries in Korea! Only reason I knocked off a star is the service is spotty. It's either on point or it'll take you 30 minutes to get your drinks. It might help to get those call buttons for service for waiters like in Korea;) other than that, it would be 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato swirls, crispy pork belly, fire chicken, wings and more galore!

KLVV94h9rh2w4gWjCTq1pQ.text: I love the chicken wings here! Went here for a nice, late lunch with a friend and I don't regret the recommendation my co-worker gave me!!

TbHkOepTn4WLz4Sg7v-CcQ.text: Southern style meets Asian fusion! This place is phenomenal. They have an "adult" beer games set up for beer pong outside, perfect for the fall weather. The inside decor was also cool with the bar on the left as you walk in and tables to the right with a V.I.P. room in the corner. The manager was nice enough to provide us the room with our party because we had two little ones with us. The menu was pretty simple and meant to be shared. A few of my favorites that we ordered were the kimchi fries, crispy pork belly (it's the Filipino in me....reminded me so much of lechon), and the sweet potato birds nest which was crispy with the hint of honey! I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Uptown Charlotte. The parking was tough, there were limited spots on the side but we managed. It was the first day of College Football that's why it was packed otherwise I'm sure it's not too bad any other day. I can't wait to be back here the next time I visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi Mayo Slaw, Kimchi Fries, Bulgogi Taco, Half &amp; Half Wings, Sweet Potato Birds Nest, and Crispy Pork Belly.

dTDUW7sIMcGRIwtFa8Btlw.text: I love the idea of this restaurant! Its like Korea meets southern cooking. I came and got the beef rib which was probably the best meat ive ever had (pause). It was very juicy and tender. The rib looked like it was off the side of a bull! It was so good!   For the sides we ordered the dirty rice x2 (soo good) broccoli (it was fresh broccoli with gochujang sauce on top) and the kimchi ramen chili (good but tasted more like chili than kimchi). We also had the extra kimchi cucumbers which was really good! We also got the The potato swirl which was ok at best.   For dessert it was the green tea biscuits. Basically was green tea ice cream with doughnuts which was awesomee. One of the few places id say id come back for!

cB2EaHNtGEEpwv9GsCE3lw.text: I had half an order of chicken with spicy  bbq sauce and cheese. I also had some Cajun spiced potatoes that were nice and crispy.  My friend had a taco but it was full of cabbage and she was not impressed!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice and crispy Cajun spiced potatoes.
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Really tasty spicy bbq chicken with cheese!
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cute place right next to uptown with free parking and delicious food!

0Nszp-S__1wMdA09ag5slQ.text: The best chicken wings I have ever had anywhere (soy garlic). The food here is great, consistent every time, always comes out fast and hot. Love the $4 menu. One of my top ten restaurants in Charlotte.

kX6aqcpohmF5Td9YuNg8eA.text: Such a cool spot! Great for dinner, drinks or all of the above. The menu can be difficult to maneuver if you're not familiar with that type of food, but just do yourself a favor and get the soy garlic chicken wings. They offer a lot of fruit beers (pineapple, blueberry, etc.) that I'm pretty sure they mix up in house. Normally fruit beers are my go-to, but these taste more like a shandy vs craft beer brewed with fruit. Definitely a top spot in South End!

jYFMW42vgPpwmYwM5eEqSg.text: My brother lives in Charlotte and said we HAVE to go here. He was right. These are some of the best wings I've ever had! I always get the soy garlic... a must. It could use a little dipping sauce but there are still great!!! The beef rib is also delicious and falls right off the bone(the best). I can't wait to go back.

XmrF6IaWyst5e24OcPfzVA.text: 4.75 Star Review!  I've been DYING to go to Seoul ever since I found its Instagram page and tonight was finally that night. I ordered the Bao buns, Sweet Potato Hash, Spicy Ram n' Mac, Lychee Soju, and I took on the WHOLE FRIED TILAPIA!!! Everything was AMAZING; however, the Spicy Ram n' mac tasted more like buffalo sauce than a take on mac & cheese. Was tasty, but I was expecting a hometown favorite.   Now...the tilapia....  THE most tender, juiciest fish I have EVER had in my 25 years of Life!! Honestly, if it weren't for the bones, I would have inhaled the entire thing in one large bite. DEFINITELY recommend, if patient enough to be wary of bones.   Lychee Soju was great. Came in a personal shaker and didn't initially TASTE strong, but the second I got up, I felt the entire shaker hit at once. VERY tasty, though  If the Ram n' Mac was cheesier, I'd give Seoul a 5-star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Current drinks menu, as items and pricing has changed.
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Current food menu, as items and prices have changed.
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Ram n&#39; Mac could have been cheesier.

MJJicMAalGLo5LJG76ns8Q.text: Southern BBQ with a Korean Twist.   Seoul Food Meat Company is an excellent barbecue establishment with huge portions of perfectly fried/smoked/grilled meats with just a very small hint of Korean flavors. If you are not an adventurous eater, the meats are not very diverse in flavor and you will find familiar favorites. My favorite was the Beef Rib and the Fire Chicken, both are perfectly cooked with just a hint of that amazing Korean kick.  If you want to get crazier, the sides are really what you should focus on, there's a variety of 12-15 or so sides, each one looks better than the next. Ram N' Cheese was actually surprisingly not terrible and one of the better of the indulgent sides. Be warned though, they will fill you up!  The service is also super friendly and the dining area is very clean. I love the natural lighting the place gets during the daytime. Would definitely recommend to a friend, especially if it's their first time in Charlotte.

kJrRXIfTUoB3T_S2W9nvEg.text: The wings were a lot better this time than the first time we went. Love the shrimp chips with the pimento cheese dip.  Didn't love the pork belly or the 'mac n cheese', which is really just ramen noodles with a not so great cheese sauce, but I would definitely go back for the wings.

giMbN2L6t6G6wx5NuJ_VkQ.text: I really love the kimchi Mac and cheese. It was different but amazingly good. I also loved my spicy wings. The staff were friendly and attentive and I enjoyed the atmosphere.

UrPYdgKsHJ4oIK0JPCiZyQ.text: Which I could rate this zero stars. Worse service at the bar . Completely ignored me . Had to flag the bartender to order after 10minutes then they ignored me for the rest of my time there. Never asked if I needed anything or refill my drink. Nothing. Food is not great either. Came cold

KtLL8T_alk_AtlvEHFAzAw.text: Cute spot located in South End that specializes in southern inspired dishes with an Asian fusion. The wings are everything which I would recommend the soy garlic wings. Their speciality drinks are a little lite on the alcohol but when you ask for a drink not on the menu the drinks came back amazing, I'm thinking cause they looked up the ingredients . One of my friends ordered the deviled eggs which looked green to me so I passed but he loved them lol.   They have a wonderful patio which in the south can be good and bad with the heat we sweated our butts off but it was well worth it. They play Asian videos and music that are very close to hip hop and R&B which was really cool.   They also serve drinks in actual fruit like coconut and watermelon that I want to try but with real alcohol lol. Anyway very cool spot to try and the service was great.   Hidden gem, a must try

d7MmGcdCHUUV-f9ddxz_Eg.text: Bulgogi Kim bap and kimchi pork tacos for lunch is bomb. Not too pricey and staff is always on point. Not stingy on the bulgogi either which is huge...don't want a big ole roll of rice. Definitely an easy quick lunch

HWMrpXXtrhw-ziV2bA7wDQ.text: I had come to this place a few times because of the tofu wings. It had been recommended by the wait staff multiple times for vegetarians. This last time I had dined there the bartender asked if I was a strict vegetarian and had informed me that the tofu wings are fried in the same oil as the chicken wings. It really bothers me that this is not clearly stated anywhere on the menu and the staff does not bother to say anything about this. I am so very grateful for the bartender that did speak up and let me know. However, I now know there is nothing truly vegetarian friendly here despite what the restaurant says.

YABXWWN43_0IU0tbqbHL1g.text: When I heard the word pork belly was on the menu I  ripped my shirt off and turn green until I dose myself with 10 lbs  of pork belly..After I bathed myself like a Dog , I realize this restaurant was very hip trendy service was awesome with beautiful young Korean ladies and men , if you like Korean men , I will stick with Pork bellys instead .  Very cool relaxed place..  I will come back.. I enjoyed it ...I really love this place long time..

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

rEkmznItLsmJhc1ihAvieA.text: This place is awesome! Great food and great service. I'm from NY and I was visiting friends here in Charlotte. I had a wonderful experience. Definitely a place to visit if your in Charlotte!!!! I will be back!

_dpX6VHL4iKg4_o4yjOt0Q.text: Awesome addition to the Gold District. Limited menu since it was their 2nd night. The pulled pork and chicken wings were outstanding. Especially enjoyed the side pickles and daikon. Looking forward to repeat visits as the menu grows. Also hoping for more kimchee options in the future. Baby friendly.

ry96b_OFGBXh5j6SoQBBrQ.text: Came here for the first time with my boyfriend last night and we were not impressed. The only decent thing about it was our server, Rebekah. She was very attentive and very nice. We did find our food runner to be a tad awkward. She brought our food to the wrong table twice and each time when she realized it was our table, she just awkwardly dropped it off with no eye contact and just slithered away. It would have been nice for a smile or anything... But no.   Moving along to the food, we got the Korean ribs, pull pork taco, brisket taco, collards, and wings. The Korean ribs had no flavor whatsoever, we were blown and shocked. The tacos were just okay .. as were the collards. The wings were just okay too, they did have a little too much sauce on them and plus we had like only two napkins on our table...yikes.  Overall we probably wouldn't come back for the food but maybe for drinks later in the future. This place has great potential but needs more flavor profiles in their food.

dANNAVaij5kpw816nVyUCg.text: Great food and great service!! No cons, tons of pros. We loved the pulled pork and the chicken. You HAVE to get the ramen mac n cheese. The dessert and drinks are really good also. Will definitely be back!

SQk8m2Js9kxOI89zUEaR1A.text: This place offers some really out of the box food. Amazing combo of Korean and Southern Comfort. Would recommend this to any adventurous or curious eater!

6I0y4Yzolkn5iwPtxMovSA.text: Not your typical Korean BBQ - this place is a fusion of Korean and Soul food. We went on a decently busy night. Great atmosphere, friendly and attentive servers, and amazing food. We had the Fire Chicken, Kimchi Pork Spare Ribs, Doenjang Collard Greens, Chojang Broccoli Salad, Ramen Mac & Cheese. Just the right amount of spice in the food but some of the side sauces have a bite! Would definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire Chicken, Kimchi Pork Spare Ribs, Doenjang Collard Greens, Chojang Broccoli Salad, Ramen Mac &amp; Cheese

B-92_1GNEvDXWcrlxHRZvA.text: I thought this place was alright. Great ambiance and great drinks (minimal ice so it makes you feel like you're getting a good sized drink). The food comes out extremely quick but the service is so-so...minimal water refills and may forget if you asked for a condiment or side. We had high hopes for the food though - we ordered the half and half wings and while the flavor was awesome they were SO fried, like the most deep fried wings I've had to date. We also got the BBQ pork which was pretty good, the Sausage that was cold BUT maybe it's supposed to be served that way? Our waiter wasn't around for us to ask. And the mac n cheese sounds great but really its like ramen noods with non mixed in cheese and pork rinds on top. Overall - I may come back...but probably only for drinks and a good hang out spot.

iRpDsgMPJQiEH6aSscvnqA.text: First of all, we went to the soft opening and we were still impressed by the service.  Not only was our server, Jennifer J, fantastic, but when of the dishes sold out they offered us an upgrade to the best option in the restaurant. A $10 upgrade - for free.  Let's talk about the food, now. It was amazing. We loved the beef ribs, the ramen Mac and cheese, the bao buns, and the sweet potato birds nests. No complaints, nothing but fantastic things to say. We will be back way too many more times.

Qpy0MUkyS750qh0e5mSRgg.text: The food is really unique and delicious. The table management and food service experience are terrible.  Expect to wait, even with half the tables empty. Wait staff are inattentive.  This is my third time eating in. I will only do takeout from now on.

71fAqSZmn1KsHt8dELRr3g.text: First time here and we will be back!  The food and awesome service at the bar made up for the crappy hostess. We ordered the large wings - half soy garlic and half spicy BBQ. The wings are huge - so much so that we took home about half of them. The kimchi cole slaw is a must. Delish collard greens and the bao buns are heavenly!  The atmosphere is carefree accompanied by Korean pop videos that appear straight out of the 90s. Patio looks awesome - cannot wait to try it next time.

VEb8cPUERaqM8_hxCEzB7A.text: Very awesome, unique place.  We shared pork belly, wings (with half spicy and half soy garlic), and collard greens.  We also tried their watermelon soju.  Everything was very good.  Pork belly was very crispy, too much so for my boyfriend, but I loved it.  Very salty though.  Wings were great.  And the soju was served in a watermelon.  I would definitely go back and try more things, but for 3 people we were stuffed.

GsMwJI6dBPW4rn8v-qSEUA.text: Menu is very small. Most of the meat was pretty good. White wine cocktail tasted like flat soda water. Got the potato side that was recommended. Just swirled cut potato with cajun seasoning. Underwhelmed with this place.

uX6GR1Vj3470D4bx8zCkAA.text: This place is such a unique little slice of heaven and the food is one of a kind good! It really is Korean soul food! Bear in mind that everything is 'a la carte' but to me, that's a good thing because I'm one of those people that often doesn't want a side and then wastes a boatload of fries that comes with my meal, or wants all the sides and gets some major upcharges. Rather than substituting or wasting food- you order exactly what you want and it's the perfect portion. Not to mention the food is delicious! I recommend the wings, as they are HUGE, crispy, and have the perfect flavor. If we're being really real though, my favorite thing on the entire menu is the spiraled potatoes. They somehow cut a potato into one big spiral, put it on a stick with some kind of heavenly seasons and then deep fry it and it is honestly the best a potato you could possibly get. If you go (which you should), definitely try the potatoes! This place will not disappoint!

xyf-3rmE0B9aM_Eb2zk5Yw.text: Gimmicky joint with inattentive service. The barbecue isn't Korean and they don't have any Soju. This place is a waste of time. Spend your dollars elsewhere.

vWLMF4xipG6d6WJbgBjIeQ.text: Stopped by on a road trip and had the soy garlic wings, cracklings, kimchi slaw, deviled eggs, and mango lemonade. Everything was delicious, even the cracklings were homemade and we're making popping noise throughout my meal. The chicken was my favorite. It was twice fried, so it was crispy and hot. It had the perfect amount of sauce. Our server was attentive and helpful and even recommended places to visit on our trip (thanks, Christy)! This was a great place for dinner and I wish I hadn't been designated driver so I could have sampled the watermelon soju. Thanks for a great dining experience!

UU4cmNrIzmIjRjvd5rpnbQ.text: The fire chicken and the potato swirl were amazing. The pulled pork was a bit fatty. The birds nest (fried sweet potato) wasn't anything special. Kimchi coleslaw was good, as well as the broccoli. Definitely try the flavored soju! I can't wait to go back and try the wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pineapple soju
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire chicken, pulled pork, birds nest and broccoli.

yLsgePqOpPH7NviG7Daxkg.text: Some friends and I ventured to Seoul Food on a Saturday evening. The six of us were seated immediately at large picnic table on the patio. We decided to split 3 large orders of meat and two sides a piece. Our eyes might have been bigger than out stomach. We were all stuffed and we still had a few small left overs.  Wings and pulled pork were definitely the favorites. Large crispy wings with good flavor and very juicy. Tender, moist pulled pork with a little sauce on top and extra on the side. We had the kimchi spare ribs as well. They were good and tender, but for $ 6-7 more than most of the other meats, I probably won't get it again.  As for sides we ordered the potato swirl, Pimento cheese with shrimp chips, Bao Buns, Ramen mac n cheese, spicy cracklins ( pork rinds with siracha dust). The swirl was good, but very small. Buns serve a good vessel to shovel the vast quantities of meat in. Pimento cheese was very tasty and good for sharing. Ramen was not that good, cracklins are good but nothing special.    Overall, the meats are definitely the star here, but here. Good value for the amount and quality of food you get. We'll definitely be going back again.

a-VJ6_ceT3N2UOJsTIBiPw.text: We were very excited to try out new Korean restaurant in Charlotte. Went there for lunch and we were very disappointed on their food.  They do not serve authentic Korean food.  The Korean kimchi Sausage was very dry and the chicken wings has too much batter on it.

ngWSpFgCANkXZyei-zuA_w.text: Literally the best wings I've ever had and I actually hated wings before this place. Also, the grapefruit beer is amazing.

kWAOlshgkuHsv6mHPsKyRA.text: Beef ribs and the wings are amazing. Went 3 days in a row because of them. I think it even restored my faith in humanity...

cKN7HpnMbZ_AZ-KPHjCWNg.text: Except the loudness, everything is good .  The fish tacos are the best I have ever had. The chicken wings are tasty. Ribs are soft , could use a little more sauce/seasoning. Service was fast and courteous.  Over all we had a good time and enjoyed the food.

918QtKZPKwrVfxyUPvyDxw.text: LOVE the wings! I actually crave it some days...it's a nice location and outdoor seating is available too.

BqHT02WakZAwbmq2lbPnUg.text: Go during the weekday happy hour for a great deal on all the sides. Smoked wings are great as are the side but the pork and chicken are just ok. Favorite sided, deviled eggs, Ramen Mac and potato swirls. Also very dog friendly patio with dog play area.

BzWCUPL5H9FU6QEDIhzzYA.text: Omg where do I start , I took my date here and they didn't only impress her but me as well. Def a good spot for first dates .

zuGSPfSWQnSTlzru9B8U6g.text: Great people, awesome atmosphere. Karaoke is a blast there. The good is a little different, but I'm excited to hear that they are adding an authentic KBBQ.

k0t6ikvNzH2_WCu0zMFXjg.text: Tons of food delivered on cafeteria-like trays. Delicious different tastes. Love the fire chicken and the tacos. Favorite item: kimchi ramen mac n cheese.

xlDobUAoFSZ2cmRGJ09hiw.text: Interesting place that has a southern and Korean fusion. The environment was nice and laid back.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy pork belly, pulled pork, ramen mac n&#39; cheese, kimchi mayo slaw, and the spicy garlic and soy wings. The soy wings were my favorite.

5uW0zlwHC9IOEPWrJKe0EA.text: Love this place, very authentic food  Good vibe and lots to do, outdoor area is nice &

Pc3TldfDhjPO18rUGJK3Eg.text: The food is flavorful and everything is "family style. The soy garlic wings are to die for crunchy, juicy and full of flavor. The sauce on the whole fried fish was delicious however I did find it very hard to eat with all of the bones and couldnt find a lot of meat. I guess that's what you get when it's whole fried lol. As far as the sides, the pimento cheese corn is bomb. Would recommend as an appetizer, it's served with rice chips. LOVED the tomato ponzu. My one complaint is the cheap flimsy cardboard lunch boat they expect you to eat out of. Please upgrade to regular plates!!     Cant wait for the full menu to roll out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

4ME7e_vfUI1FSUNbgMcLBQ.text: I'm one to never give a bad review. Maybe this style food isn't for me but that aside I ordered pork there was fat on every bite and on the top of each piece was a very hard layer that wasn't eatable in my dtand

QslKuJaEIITfCW2p9jSXtg.text: Excellent food and service. I got the wings (half and half) and both flavors were amazing. I also had the spiral potato, shredded pork, and the buns. Overall everything was amazing and I'll definitely be going back.

NfkGbXgUALatBbrcIy0Icg.text: I watched a bartender under poor several groups throughout the night.  Eventually when I ordered a drink from the bar, the same thing happened to me as I watched her make the drink.  I ordered a vodka soda, and when I looked at it, it was entirely carbonated through the drink (unusual for a drink with alcohol in it).  I proceeded to drink it as well as my buddies, almost entirely club soda.  I then asked the bartender to poor me a different drink and confessed that I had witnessed her do the same thing prior to my order.  She proceeded to cry and ask, "are you calling me a liar?" -multiple times and as it got very awkward for me, she asked me if she could buy me another drink, I really did not want a drink bought for me on a bartenders tab.  She then went around the bar and proceeded to get more and more angry.  All I wanted was a repour, of a simple drink, and did not want to start any drama.  Then the manager came out and claimed that we called the bartender was racist.  In a nutshell, it all got very odd, over dramatic and uncomfortable very quickly.  I will never come back here, simply because of how inappropriate the staff was over a simple request, and how they proceeded to make the situation a race thing.  Oh my, oh my.

vZa8elN20b8BevcHatrtIQ.text: I love love love this place! From the location, the decor,  the hospitality,   the staff, and of course the main event, the FOOD!  It took me a while to get in this place but when I finally got the chance to come I haven't stopped going back!! The service is always great here. Server menu knowledge is always on point and are always willing to give suggestions. Food is served on a large tray and everything can be shared, so I suggest you get a few different things, trust me there will be plenty of food! I started with the pineapple beer that they have on tap which I find pairs well with most dishes but I'm sure any of their options are great. I go for the collards which have jalapenos which gives it a nice but not over whelming kick. I have had both the Kim Chili Ramen Mac and the Ram N Cheese both are great cant go wrong with either! Now, the meat! I have had the kimchi pork spare ribs which were fall off the bone tender and juicy! I haven't had the chance to try the beef ribs but I'm sure they are phenomenal! I also had both flavors of wings (soy garlic, spicy BBQ), while both of these are undeniably delicious and  super crispy, I am sold on the spicy BBQ, sooo good! Now to my personal favorite the Kim Baps! sushi rolls (although they look very similar) don't have nothing on these babies! My favorite is the Fire Squid, these little suckers are bite size yet hold so much flavor! Absolute must have! I will be trying the beef rib nigiri kim bap next! I'm always full by the time dessert comes around but they do have dessert options. This place is just all around good! I have made it my personal mission to have every single thing on this menu and I cannot wait to go back! 10's across the board Seoul!!!!

QxLJVgbYx_k9o7lCs-d4_A.text: I've never experienced something so overrated in my life. The wings are great but besides that. It's not really worth the hype.

c23466jmidx_SagPR6KyfA.text: Awesome food and great ambiance. The music is pleasant. The large size ribs is massive. I will definitely recommend this restaurant.

-GcILEFy9bOrAlLbkLyAPQ.text: Holy Moly this place is amazing. Let me start by saying I'm a picky eater so Korean BBQ would not be my first choice for a nice dinner. Boy, was I wrong. This was delicious. Everyone at our table was in heaven while eating. We ordered basically everything on the menu since we were a large group and everything was amazing. Cool atmosphere. Writing this review is making my mouth water. I would definitely go back again.

IwCfqrLZJuTyHRenf4C6yQ.text: The combination of Korean and Southern BBQ just makes sense. The beef rib is phenomenal. The kimchi tastes homemade. The pork, available in several forms, is succulent. You literally can't go wrong here

MNflTCGiesTogk5lMNydlQ.text: We went for 2 birthdays and the service was excellent!!! We took our waiters recommendations to order and everything was great. Love that it was family-share style. The drinks were creative and so yummy!

oXtHPVIRHp-1soAgANQpYA.text: Some great food. Interesting vibe. Great service.  Not so much family friendly. A little pricey.  Ok here's what I liked. The crispy pork belly! Omg so good. I do however wish they had additional sauces that weren't spicy. But the pork was amazing and the sauce it did come with was tasty, just a tad on the spicy side. The  sweet potato bird's nest was tasty! My husband enjoyed the loaded mashed potato salad. I can appreciate it's uniqueness but it wasn't my fave. Mostly because I don't care for cucumbers and it has their house pickled cucumbers in it and they were bigger chunks and I didn't care for the texture. But I wouldn't say it was bad.  As far as family friendly. Well not with smaller kids or picky kids. There is not a lot of selection of non spicy items. All the items are unique, which we enjoy trying new things but our 5yo was not so interested. Also, the TV's are playing some Asian pop music videos but they are pretty risque. So not so appropriate for a little one. I kept trying to avert his attention. That being said I would maybe come back I just wouldn't bring little ones.   What I really didn't like... The ramen and cheese. Yuck gag. It was horrible. Sorry, but I really hated it. Even the 5yo who loves Mac and cheese and any kind of noodles wasn't interested. Also, it was a little on the pricey side in general. ..  I would still recommend the place with no kids and no ramen.

GeJDgmDRuEovyAxMJ78Sxw.text: Sorry, I believed the hype I read online but this place did NOT deliver on soooo many levels.  Their only vegetarian entree alternative is the tofu "wings".  Being that it's an Asian restaurant you would think they would know how to properly prepare tofu.  The huge 2" cubes of tofu that came to the table were gelatinous, flavorless blobs.  Aside from the sauce they were dipped in, there was ZERO prep or attention paid to these.  The texture and consistency was nauseating.  I ate one half of ONE cube before realizing my meal was inedible.  I did order the Ramen Mac and Cheese (without the srirachi cracklings) and that was "ok", but nothing that would cause me to return here.  The spiral potato thing was decent.  Waitress asked what the problem was with my uneaten tofu and I told her in detail everything that was wrong with the dish.  She apologized and then promptly brought the bill and charged me for them.    Really?  Feel empowered to make it right in the eyes of me, your customer, and swallow the $0.99 (for a $9 dish) you have invested in these tofu hunks and make me want to give you another chance.  There's absolutely ZERO reason for me to return here.  The generic industrial-chic decor is a positive.  That and the spiral potato thing.  That's all.

nGte88K__3VVXYdpNLjRJA.text: Great wings! Great service! Coming back for more food and karaoke! Get the pork belly and bulgogi roll.

BXU6NjLw-2EJckhLFjX5CA.text: We ordered the crispy pork belly, ramen Mac, tacos, and wings. The ramen Mac was delicious, tacos were great, but the crispy pork belly was not crispy and lacked flavor. The wings were heavily fried and difficult to eat. I probably will not be coming back.

3pLg9AhFD9CMoq0-UWFAGw.text: Yikes, over priced and forgettable food with decent service. The wings are Hawkers and Bon Chon are better.

-m-KElp7nJcLFllAIrAK7Q.text: I stopped in here on a Friday night out of convenience, knowing nothing about the restaurant. At first glance, I thought the menu was underwhelming, but everything I ordered packed a punch! I got the fire chicken with kimchi fries and potato swirl - all were excellent and the portions were much larger than I expected! I sat at the bar and had great service. I suppose the knocks on this place would be a lack of authenticity (though I don't mind that if the food is still this delicious) and the noise level. I will definitely go back.

0s7m8bbhv9vvTR-9jbUIbA.text: . What do two middle aged men with decent expense accounts do. Load up on what seemed like a buffet amount of sides and wings. Think bar food with a Korean twist. The crispy garlic wings are reason unto themselves for a trip to the Soul Food Meat Company.  There seemed to be too many side dishes to try everything in one visit. If you can't find something you like here  then you probably just don't like food. The highlights were kimchi fries and as mentioned above the garlic wings. The pork butt was good (exactly as it should be) just not special in the way that everything else was.

N16iXqogq67ggAzl-BUtGg.text: Amazing sides - a little bit of a wait. We sat at the bar on a Friday just to be able to order faster. Sides can add up. We got 2 sides - Sweet potato bird nest & ram Mac & cheese. Both delicious! Then we shared a couple of tacos and a kim pap (not sushi)  Overall great food will be back but be prepared to spend 50+ with sides and drinks. As everything is ala carte

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

VT0WXR7CL_qR0Qk9SYM8kw.text: This was my first Korean BBQ experience and I already know it would be hard to top. Great group or family style set up with excellent food. There was amazing flavor in the pulled pork, kimchi fries, pork belly and basically everything! Perhaps the "ramen" mac n cheese was not what I was expected but everything else was amazing. It's my go to spot for anyone who comes in to visit! The staff is super friendly and helpful on helping pick out what suits the table or your taste buds.

ZiY7ogLv9dTziiwv0dUm-Q.text: Kind of awesome, beef rib was excellent. Kim chili ramen mac was good. Would definitely come here again.

U_FRiE5fN86_U6aNrhWJeQ.text: They have the best wings in town and the kimchi fries are unbelievable! We love stopping by on our way to football games.

JYufvnJk1ldTtvbQ2SuIhg.text: This has been my favorite restaurant in the city, probably since it opened. Never fails to disappoint. It's about time I left a review.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi Fries, Beef Ribs
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bulgogi Beef Tacos

mIApZ3ZnPV1GQsXGnAm2-Q.text: Overall it was pretty good. The chicken wings were definitely on point. We got the half and half, and the soy garlic wings were delicious. We tried some of the tacos and the bulgogi taco was on point, however the pulled pork taco was so disappointing. It was so dry and I couldn't eat it. The pimento corn cheese was good, but the presentation was better than the taste. The service was friendly, the food was good, but I just was a tad disappointed based on previous reviews and the price was a tad high.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Corn Cheese

W-L_zYdXRtwRsNFVX1QfQA.text: There's not much that I can say that hasn't already been said. This place, this food... everything was awesome. We started with the wings, half and half. Soy ginger wings are the best I've had in Charlotte. The crispy pork belly loved it. The collards weren't anything to write about. Probably won't get those again but they have you a healthy portion. The buns were a good compliment to the pork belly. Coming back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

j55TfqUlNOQ9zNWpesU48A.text: With the opening college football game of the year schedule for Saturday, we knew we needed to make a booking for a big Friday night reunion with friends well and advance. Called the restaurant up on Monday of that week, let them know we needed a big table and that I was in a power wheelchair and could use some extra room. They assured me it would be no problem and took the reservation. We got a phone call that Friday morning confirming our Booking.   Upon arrival, we were escorted to a private room; a perfect setting for the evening. Our waitress, Gabby, introduced herself, left menus and took our drink orders. Excellent selection of beers and speciality drinks. The first round, of many, arrived promptly and we started ordering from the $4 sides selections. Deviled, pickled eggs and Sirracha cracklings for the table got things started with unique tastes enjoyed by all. For our main courses, we ordered pork belly, wings, pulled pork barbecue, fire squid and a plethora of the sides. Everyone was given a paper plate and the main courses arrived on steel platters; perfect for passing around and sharing.   Gabby kept the drinks coming, the mgr stopped by to see how things were going and let us know the room was ours for as long as we wanted. Our group was from NJ, GA, TN and Charlotte (college friends together for the game) and enjoyed the meal and setting immensely.

Dt0ZjyyUVOhhaLGeCQWvmw.text: So looks like most of the reviews are either hot or cold. This is my first time here and maybe I just came with the right people.   The wings were the best part - double fried Korean Style - the coatings were unreal and so crispy - the Soy Garlic and Spicy both kick butt - try them both! The Cracklins were good covered with the Sriracha/spice powder - the portion was huge and is plenty to share - they almost seem to magically refill themselves!! The last best thing was the fried tofu - nice firm texture and lots of flavor. The potato salad and the Ramen Mac and Cheese were nothing to write home about.  If you are a drinker - go all out and get the Coconut Soju - dude (or dudette) it's just not a party without that Soju - it will sneak up on you and kick your a$$. Warning - do not try to eat the coconut - not that I'd know anything about that (ahem).  I would definitely come back for the wings!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

1KmASKK1p11U42yyZtmF9Q.text: THEY'RE WINGS ARE TO DIE FOR! Some of the best chicken wings I've had in my life. Order them. Your welcome.   I also ordered some ribs and they were super tender and tasty.   Get they're loaded fries too! Super tasty. Atmosphere is really cool. Service there was good and employees were super helpful with choosing what to get. Definitely recommend Seoul! I'm new to Charlotte, this is one of the best spots I ate at so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

d_q6hFVxGhP7VW4BacnwXA.text: I dont have a bad word to say about the food or our experience. First off this isnt traditional Korean bbq but it's the best we've ever had. All the food comes family style and the large plates of protein are big enough to share but if you get the rib get two you wont want to share it. We got the large brisket entree and the beef rib. The rib comes on the bone and fell right off,(we took the bone home for our pup and hes happy) the waitress tried to cut it but it pulled apart on it's own. The most tender meat I've ever had in my life. The brisket is nice and fatty with a good smoke and char and the rib has amazing charcoal flavor that  isnt too overbearing. We had the potato spiral and the spring rolls for our sides and they were both amazing and full of flavor. The waitress was very knowledgeable and super patient with us as it was our first visit. There are so many other things we want to try so we will definitely  be back. Amazing night!!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Rib and brisket
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bulgogi Spring Roll
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato Spiral

u8HpGGo5Y3CHPK9Iec0TNw.text: This review is only based on the karaoke room and our server. This karaoke room is such a great concept. It doesn't really fit the restaurant concept in my opinion but I'm happy they had that option. The karaoke buttons are in some other language than English but the host try's to explain it. The drinks were good and the food was meh! I'll be back for the karaoke though.

ELuq8vJFMNUTAnau8oMooA.text: Went here while on a work trip! I would definitely come back!  Parking: Evenings are pretty busy, so street parking is your best bet. You shouldn't have to wait around too long to find nearby parking, or at least I didn't have to.    Ambiance: I read plenty of reviews before going so I was pretty aware of what to expect given the Korean Southern fusion theme.  Fair amount of dine in seating  with one bar inside and an additional bar outside.  You must be okay with the loud bar feel!  It can get pretty loud inside!  Service: Everyone was really attentive and quick!  The hostess had a lot going on at the front, but managed it well.  ***They add you to a list if you need to wait and they will call two times before dropping you, so be sure to keep your phone full volume and on vibrate. ***  Food: I ordered the half and half soy garlic and spicy wings and fell in loooove with them. I love Korean chicken wings and these were the best by far. If you are a fan of Bonchon you will be even more in love with this place! They had a great crunch and were dressed well on the outside with juicy tender meat under the skin!  I also ordered the kimchi fries, which were also good! The kimchi had a great flavor!  I also ordered pork belly...which was amazing! Crunchy and the right amount of chewy fat.   All in all, great place and would recommend to anyone visiting Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

siEtQ0AjxmuDn1ze5-MzPQ.text: I've been meaning to write a review for the longest.   Food- I dont have any complaints about anything on the menu.  The wings are always hot and the sauce is unique.  I recently tried the green tea cornbread  (Im glad I did) it was soooo delicious.  I wouldnt have ever thought to put those two together. Kimbap (not sushi) is also a musy try. I enjoy the fire chicken with a side of fire sauce. I haven't had the opportunity to try the main dishes ,but its extremely hard to when their wings are so good.   Service - It tends to be a little slow at times yet the servers are still friendly and welcoming. This may come during their peak hrs. They are attentive and prompt when it comes to bringing out your food and making sure you have what you need.   Overall, I enjoy the atmosphere and food everytime I visit!

xgNdl4d67-8fKB18cECFYw.text: Yet another lackluster addition to Southend framed in a fun, millennial appealing atmosphere.   The silver lining for this place is their wings. As many others have said in their reviews, their wings are pretty damn good. If you skip out on the wings, you will probably be curious as to why this place is always packed (pro tip, get the Korean BBQ flavor).   The drinks...I ordered an old fashioned, which is pretty hard to mess up, but boy did they mess it up. After 10 minutes the waiter brings out what looks to be someone's drink that had 2 sips left, to which I asked "is this someone else's drink?". He laughed and replied with "that's just how it comes". $13 in the hole for this crap; I was not laughing. It was a watered down mess. I think a nun that's never had a sip of alcohol in her life could probably make a better one. The beer I ordered was also a joke, brought out in a 10oz plastic cup and charged $6 for. $20 later and didn't even have a buzz.   The rest of the food is certainly different and I think it just tries too hard. Their version of chili cheese fries are the kimchi fries. It's a muddled mess of flavor that doesn't mesh well with french fries. Their version of "burgushi" from Cowfish is not exciting at all. Bulgogi beef with no flavor that's wrapped in rice and kelp is just a terrible idea. If you have to put a warning on the menu about it "not being sushi", then it's probably indicative of something that's just a bad idea all around.   Seoul Food Meat Company looks like it should be a killer spot. Unfortunately I think the best thing about this place are the cornhole boards out back. Joining the likes of Zeppelin for crappy, overrated spots in Southend...2.5/5.

ZbcKwRjeXRAtgmssaY4WYg.text: I could write an ode to Seoul Food Meat Co and it wouldn't be enough. I love this place. Everything is super flavorful and the Korean and southern food twists make it a unique dining spot. Where else can you rent a karaoke room, play human pool, drink butter beer, and watch k-pop music videos while eating Mac n cheese ramen? You're right, no where else.  The service is great, the food is delicious, and the drinks are reasonable. Want more incentive? Read on   The soy garlic wings are the best wings I've ever had. They're huge, they're breaded/coated with something fantastic and crunchy, and the soy garlic sauce is out of this world. It's salty, it's sweet, but it's also light enough where it's not overpowering. Go ahead and try the other flavor...it's good. It's just not "out of this world" good. You don't regret the soy garlic wings.   Best food on the menu: Soy Garlic Wings, Ramen Mac n Cheese, Soy Deviled Eggs  Things that are ok (not bad, just not my faves): Potato Swirl, the "other" wings  Instagramable Drink: Any of the Soju in the fruit. The pineapple is my fave!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. 30 Soy Garlic Wings and the Potato Swirl
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Yuzu-Jar
Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States

n59k4Lp5CmRbDbh0CF526w.text: They have a place for my baby German Shepherd to play. Had water  bowels and water faucet. I would have given it a five stars for the food.   However I felt the service/how they did things makes it a 4. I am by myself with my baby. Would have been nice if someone just came out to take my orders. We first came up to the front and was told, go to the back, put dog in play ground and then come to the bar and order your food, which I did. Then someone came out and told me my food was ready at the bar, went in and got it. Weird!!! FYI it was lunch time and not busy.   Food had good flavor, but cold. But maybe it sat at the bar!!!  -Pork belly barbecue had good flavors and the Barbecue sauce had a nice kick. -Sriracha cracklings were the bomb with large portion. we had the Sriracha powder seasoning on the side. -spicy wings: crispy and great sauce. -ramen Mac n cheese ok, ramen too soft, lack texture. -sweet potatoes bird nest. Thin and crispy, drizzled with light syrup. I put the Sriracha powder seasoning, which made it even better.  -spring rolls, had lots of fillings but too greasy and didn't have much flavor, very blah, had to drowned it in sauce.   I recommend this place. Good food with a twist makes me want to return and try other items.

JwIgR-vCyiahToBHGMcWfA.text: Just soo good, amazing Philly steak and cheese egg rolls smoking good   Amazing wings too

Wbzs_vgS95V2G7MGVcFIEw.text: Mmmm I really wanted to like this place since my friend recommended it to me and the reviews looked so promising!   Sigh  I was expecting some good korean fried chicken. Although it's meant to be a blend between normal fried chicken and korean fried chicken, it was just not up to par with what I'm used to. The flavor was crispy and great on the outside but the actually chicken on the wings was bland leaving much to be expected.   I also got the kimchi fries and that was not bad but not necessarily blow my mind! I think if they included som bulgogi or a little bit more meat it would've made it amazing even if it meant charging a little bit more for it! I've had bulgogi fries before and they were amazing but this just wasn't up to par.  Service was great though and my waiter was super friendly and informative!   Parking wise you're gonna have to find  street parking which isn't too bad.   Overall, it's good but don't go with expectations of good korean fried chicken

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul Food Meat Company - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean fried wings (sweet and spicy) $13 Kimchi fries $5

gxyRd1ZgqJfn23eoJSdJtg.text: YUMMY! Unintentionally came by during their happy hour and my goodness $1 sides!! YESSSS. What a great Korean/American bbq spot. The deviled eggs and egg rolls had to be my favorite side and the soy ribs were so tender! The kfc (Korean fried chicken) was probably the best I've had so far along with their kimchi fries the sauce was on the side to reduce the higher chance of them getting too soggy. The service was good nothing amazing, but that's ok. Also, had their sweet biscuit and green tea dessert so yummy! Overall, don't just walk there RUN and get you some good bbq.

OXyEYNfnFJ6Nk7xPN6s6oA.text: This was my second time going to Seoul food and I enjoyed it. wEDniE1eC-TjFTWtCNprKA.text: We were there for our first time last Saturday. So good. We had the best server, Courtney! She was so attentive and very helpful with the process & descriptions of anything we were unsure of. I am sure she was a huge part of why our experience was so good! M5Vc7VdhdnV-ALPmdE_UVQ.text: Really dope concept. I think a lot of fusion food feels really forced but I was able to enjoy this. We got the 12 hour beef rib and fire chicken with a potato swirl.   The 12 hour beef rib was pretty fire. Super tender and our server used a knife and slid the whole thing off the bones for us, very photogenic. It's the whole beef rib so it has all the fat and bits you would expect. Just as appealing to eat as it is to look at.  The fire chicken was ok, spicy chicken with cheese, but the cheese was melted on with a blowtorch and unfortunately it left the cheese with a really strong propane flavor which honestly kind of ruined it for me.  Potato swirl was pretty good, hard to mess that one up IMO.   I honestly really enjoyed the beef rib and that plus the pretty extensive side menu would bring me back. The service was also really dope and our waiter gave us a bunch of suggestions of things to check out in the city while we were visiting.

LFelKAzFbP0Zpe1pvwKGjA.text: Omg! Look this place up on yelp for a late night run with the husband and it was so spot on! It is like Asian street fare. It was so good. The place was clean, staff friendly. We were sat immediately. Deonte was our server and he was so well informed about the menu. We got the wings, spicy bbq and garlic soy. Garlic soy is better. Philly egg-rolls are good. We had the kimchi fries. Gotta get those. So many layers of flavors in one dish. I can't rave enough about this place. They have music and videos playing so it is a little loud, but I actually enjoyed watching another culture's music videos. The food is cheap. Go! Enjoy! I'll definitely be back.

LuFJM4Q3CRaTXcS_RivqAQ.text: I really tried to keep an open mind about Seoul Food because my friends who I was visiting in the area was really excited to take me and my fiance there. Unfortunately, I've definitely had better Korean fusion food. I'm sure the competition isn't that big in Charlotte, but they may want to step up their game before things start blowing up there.   For our party of 5 we ordered: -beef ribs -crispy pork belly -soy garlic wings -spicy BBQ wings -bulgogi tacos -potato salad -kimchi fries -roast beef eggrolls  Sadly, nothing that we ordered wow'd me in originality, flavor, or presentation. There were 5 of us clearly sharing everything we ordered, and we also informed our server we'd be sharing everything, but for the fairly large amount of "BBQ" we ordered we had two 2oz cups of sauce for us to dip in. Maybe we could have asked for more if anyone bothered to ask if we needed anything, but our server wasn't really that attentive.   Beef ribs were okay. The seasoning wasn't that bad, but the overall taste was just displeasing---they didn't taste like they were smoked or prepared in any special way.   Crispy pork belly reminded me of heo quay (or lechon), but definitely not as well prepared and overpriced.   Soy garlic wings were tasty, but the wings were a bit dry.  Spicy BBQ wings legit taste like they just threw them in a bowl gochujang and nothing else---I mean I'm a fan of gochujang as the next person, but really? That's it?  The bulgogi tacos were amaaaaazingly greasy. We literally had a bowl full of grease leftover. Flavor wise it was okay. I've had better Korean tacos.  Potato salad was pretty bland, and wasn't the usual Korean potato salad I was expecting.    Kim chi fries were okay I guess. To be fair my standards for Kim chi fries are pretty high because of 'oh my gogi' in htx.  Roast beef eggrolls were interesting. It was like a crunchy mini roast beef sandwich with sauerkraut lol. Can't say that I've had the anywhere else.   Not only was the food mediocre it kind of seems like they don't really care about anyone's dietary preferences or allergens because my friend is lactose intolerant, and opting out of not having cheese on the kim chi fries was infeasible.  TLDR: -mediocre Korean fusion cuisine -limited parking in a small lot shared with 'Let's Meat' -unlikely to accommodate any dietary restrictions

If you want the a more authentic experience get the original soju.

QjsEoxp_48ySJ2HfmQOyWQ.text: I pulled up in Town this weekend to be a stranger and take in local attractions .  This place caught my eye as being a blend of Korean flavors and Southern cuisine, hence Seoul Kitchen.  Count me in right.  Well my server was excellent, very nice and personable and my drink was really good.  The food was ehhhhh.  The wings, celebrated as the staple of the place, where double fried like they were supposed to be, but this crisp was stale and chewy .  To my surprise every patron was ordering and loving these wings..  to each his or her own.  The kimchi fries were excellent and the star of the show was the green tea ice cream biscuit.  I will leave it up to you to decide on this place but for me it's a One and Done.  I wish them well though.

FCy5HCNGtjYXvStdaE0_rw.text: I went here after hearing many recommendations around the Charlotte area. It did not disappoint! The food was simply spectacular! They make everything fresh and bring it out when it is ready!  They are known for their wings, but my favorite part were their fun $5 sides! We ordered two different kinds of wings, the kimchi fries and pulled pork tacos. My favorite were the kimchi fries, you MUST try them. It is honestly such a great deal, because they are only $5 and piled with cheese, meat and awesome sauces! The wings were super crispy and the sauces were wonderful. The tacos were pretty good too! If you are in the area, you MUST go!

g4wpAw6lSqiuW41q2bFLBQ.text: Decided to go here for a work outing and as we entered it was already packed. They had only been open for 30 minutes which had me excited. If they are this busy it must be great food. We ordered some wings and pulled pork and for sides we got a ramen Mac n cheese, sweet potato bird nests, philly egg rolls, collard greens, corn bread and kimchi fries. We told our waiter to leave the menu as we were deciding on drinks when we initially ordered our food.  Well, the food started pouring out of the kitchen, still no drinks and no silverware or plates to eat the food. We didn't see our waiter again till the check came out. We flagged someone down and asked for silverware and plates. We had to make due with water since the waiter never came to take our alcoholic drink orders. The food was amazing but the service left a lot to be desired.

foHFyOYC19iADnl5mRkmOQ.text: 3 of us total shared this: -crispy pork belly - 20- half & half soy garlic & spicy BBQ -potato swirl -Ramen mac & cheese -Fat bulgogi brisket taco ~with 3 people split it came out to around ~$26 per person. this was more than enough for 3 people! The food here was incredible! One of our favorites were the WINGS and the RAMEN MAC & CHEESE. Staff here was very friendly, obviously very knowledgeable, and shared with us customer favorites and gave us suggestions!  This restaurant is one you must try at least once while visiting the South End area.   Notes:  -great outdoor seating area  -outdoor games and private parking lot as well

YMl1_WOkhOjCsQJCkSH5TA.text: This place is AMAZING! The sign on the door says it's not your average Korean food and they are right! Korean BBQ was unreal! The pork belly melts in your mouth, but everything we got was delicious. The waitress was very helpful and knew the menu well. We ordered more than our fair share....and we ate it all!   What we got:  -Pork belly (small) -Fire chicken (small) -Sweet potato birds nest -Ramen mac and cheese -potato swirl  -Lycee martini     They serve everything family style so keep that in mind when ordering. They also mark on their menu what items are gluten free! Will be going back ASAP!

k3oADtMLy6q4wzHrJwdjYQ.text: I have to give Seoul Food four stars because there is still meat to be tried and games to be played. But I do have to say - the experience that The Lady and I had here was north of 4 stars.  We arrived here on a Sunday night and were seated almost immediately. I do wish we could've sat outside, but we arrived probably about 45 seconds too early... but there were nice picnic tables in the patio out front.  Our server was quick to greet us, and we ended up trying a vegetarian meal - Fire Tuna Kim Bap (which is, as much as I still don't understand, is dissimilar to sushi), cold broccoli salad with sesame oil and gochujang sauce, the soy garlic tofu blocks (this was in the place of wings), and the potato swirl with a paprika and parmesan crust. I've never seen a potato preparation even close to this swirl, so that was a fun unique take on a potato chip. And the tofu was... well, it was tofu. But the sauce on it was stellar and I could tell that it would've translated beautifully to real wings.   Everything was stellar with great flavor, seasoning, and texture. However, "Seoul Food Meat Company" kind of implies that their meat is their specialty, and I didn't get any. Next time you best believe that I'm going to try ribs or hell I may even get a whole fish. The world is my oyster.  The atmosphere of the whole restaurant is really cool, and there's Korean music videos playing on the tvs. When we were there, I got to witness the greatness that was Korean hip hop. Y'all don't know great music videos until you've seen Korean hip hop.  Lastly, the patio out back looked incredible. And I've heard that they have an innovative game... soccer pool? What is this sorcery. A definite must visit when we get more time. Anyways, maybe I'll grab John H. soon and head there since The Lady doesn't have carnivorous habits...

Oh-AllompkxPzwg7kTGNyQ.text: Great wings but the rest is a bit bland. I suppose i'm expecting more of a korean kick and punch of flavors rather than the typical american BBQ.

r8xhxqNjjGSb1fxePq44hQ.text: The wings are definitely five-star worthy, especially the soy garlic. They're crispy and have a lot of meat of them with great flavor. The rest of the menu is okay but doesn't have any stand out dishes.   The atmosphere is very cool, especially the back patio where there are yard games and a big outdoor bar. They have flavored beers like pineapple the are Saporo and pineapple juice - great combo.

vRx9K_V7njI7QOZ5YCg1bA.text: I've come here quite a bit, this is a great place to go with a group. If you order a bunch of small dishes you can share and get quite a variety. It's got great wings although there is a lot of batter on them. All the sauces are delicious though. The meats are all very good. The sides often have vinegar or soy, so I tend to stay away from most of the veggies. It's not a place to go if you're watching calories, as you'll definitely leave stuffed and salted. They have a wide variety of drinks, so it's great for beers or soju to try the local Korean drinks. If you are scheduling a bday dinner this place is perfect. Always a fun atmosphere and nice staff.

YubrrOuwZnqRyQhSmMzpyg.text: I have been here a few times now and it's always good. Sometimes there can be a little bit of a wait but not terrible. The food is interesting and tasty. The drinks are good but a little overpriced. The service is quick and Friendly. I would highly recommend it.

_-euQNb7vWJnrZFSIvj30w.text: Seoul is great. Delicious food (especially wings and fire chicken for me) and an awesome outdoor area with lots of games as well. Drink selection is solid too. The fruit Soju is good but disappointing they didn't have watermelon last time anymore.
